loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina, 49 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store along with her husband (also shown in the photo). She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, Robina needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. She has requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en: Balqees is a 35-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. She is working hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. She and her husband have been doing agriculture work for some years. They crop different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides, currently Balqees has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR. This would help her to grow more crops, which ultimately would help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a hardworking man 49 years of age, married and living in Masindi, Uganda. He has got a transport business of a fuso lorry (truck) that generates income. He built houses to rent that supplements his income. James started the business to earn a living for his family.

He needs a credit facility to build a parameter wall for his rentals.

loans.use: to build a parameter wall for his rentals.

loans.name: Kaneezan

texts.en:
Kaneezan is a 58-year-old married woman. 

She is running a business selling milk with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  Kaneezan’s job is to look after the buffalos and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. 

However they now need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore Kaneezan has requested 45,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo so they can cater to more customers and then provide their family members with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo so she and her husband can cater to more customers and then provide their family members with a better standard of living.

loans.name: Fazeelat

texts.en:
Fazeelat is a 23-year-old married woman. 

The man shown in the photo is Fazeelat ’s husband, who is a driver by profession and who provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it functioning properly. 

For this reason, Fazeelat has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires along with auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him to drive more smoothly and to provide better transport services to his passengers. 

Fazeelat is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires along with auto spare parts for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Dae Da Now Village Group-2

texts.en:
The funds will help 30 members of the Dae Da Now Village Group-2. Pictured above (from left to right) are Tin, Tin Y, Tin W, Thein and San. The featured borrower, Tin, has a seven-acre crop farm in the Delta region of Myanmar, and like many farmers in this area, savings are low before the harvest season. Farming runs in Tin's blood. He believes that as a farmer, he is looking to make a better life for his family and for the country. The loan will help him purchase the necessary farming inputs such as fertilizer and petrol for farm equipment. Proximity's loan is important for his business expansion because he no longer has to borrow from a local lender with much higher interest rates. Tin is 34 years old, married, and has a child. Part of the family’s income goes towards funding his child's education.

The CBO leaders oversee the group of 30. The funds will help the group purchase farming essentials before harvest time. Dae Da Now Village’s main focus is crop farming, as well as other seasonal plantation such as betel trees and flowers, for additional income.

loans.use: to rent farm equipment and buy crop seeds and fertilizer for 30 members of the village.

loans.name: Heriknaz

texts.en:
This young lady is 28 years old and she lives in Tsovagyugh, a village in the Gegharkunik region. Her name is Heriknaz and she lives with her husband and three children in her native village. 

Both Heriknaz and her husband are unemployed, and despite their young age they are already skilled farmers. Heriknaz mentions that through helping each other, they now have a small farm where she takes care of cows, calves, a bull, sheep and chickens. She even has several bee hives. Her plot of land is also very versatile, since on it she cultivates potatoes, garlic, cucumber, greens, tomatoes, cabbages, etc. She sells all of the gathered harvest and her farm products (milk, meat, cheese, curd, eggs and honey), sometimes at the wholesale market and sometimes right from her house.  

This loan of 700,000 Armenian drams will allow Heriknaz to manage a lot of work about her farm, such as buying fertilizer and diesel fuel for her agricultural works and she will also buy fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and diesel fuel for her agricultural works and she will also buy fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.name: Zoya

texts.en:
Zoya is 47 years old and lives with her daughter in Sevan City in the Gegharkunik region. 

Since 1983 Zoya has been working as a postwoman. For a very long time Zoya’s husband has been going abroad seasonally to work for a Russian Federation, in order to provide his family with better living conditions. 

Zoya now has some health problems which are just impossible to resolve with their small family budget. This loan will be so helpful and great for her if Kiva lenders decide to support her so she can finally resolve her health problems.

loans.use: to resolve her health problems

loans.name: Nyaung Ngu Village Group 2

texts.en:
These funds will help 21 village customers of Nyaung Ngu Village Group 2. Pictured above are the group members known as Kan, Win, Than, Win M, San and Khin. The featured borrower named Kan (in the middle) is 41 years old and married. He lives together with his family of four. He farms his six-acre crop farm and also plants seasonal foods. His wife manages their grocery store. Kan's goal for his child, who is currently at Secondary Level, is to be schooled till graduation. This loan from Proximity will help him to purchase fertilizer and petrol for cropping machines. Kan hopes that the weather will be good this year so that he can have more developments and improvements in the farm than last year.

Nyaung Ngu Village is located in Ayeyarwaddy River, Myanmar Delta Region and the village has over 1000 villagers. Most men focus on crop farming and plant flowers and betel leaves as well. In addition, they also raise livestock such as ducks and pigs for savings.

The CBO leaders oversee 21 village customers and these funds will help some members purchase fertilizer and crop seeds. The remaining members will use the funds to pay allowances for hired laborers and also for renting crop machines.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and petrol for cropping machines for 21 borrowers in the village

loans.name: Shuklarani

texts.en:
Shuklarani is a 32-year-old entrepreneur. She strives tirelessly to earn a decent income for her family.  She lives in a semi-concrete house in New Alipurduar with her husband Ranjan and three children (two sons and one daughter).  Her children go to school. Her husband is engaged in a small sofa-repair business but his income is hardly adequate to bear the household expenses along with the educational costs for their children. 

Shuklarani is associated with a business of selling women's clothing. She sells mainly saris (traditional Indian woman’s wear), blouses, suit pieces etc. from door to door in her locality. Her main customers are her relatives, friends, neighbors and acquaintances in their area. Now she wants to expand her business to get additional profit.

She is asking for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase more stock of clothing from the wholesale market so that she can satisfy her customers' demand as well can elevate her income. Shuklarani wants to grow her business and desires to provide uninterrupted education to her children with the profit generated from her business.

 She is thankful to her lenders as they extend their helping hand in her crucial time.

loans.use: To purchase stock of attire for their existing clothing business.

loans.name: Zeanat

texts.en:
Zeanat has successfully built her business of buying and selling animals with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute in the family income. 

Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she has applied a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more animals to increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales and profits.

loans.name: Shenaz

texts.en:
Shenaz is a 46-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house with her husband. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over time, they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and they make enough to meet the expenses of their three children. 

She has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater to more customers for generating a healthier source of income. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater to more customers for generating a healthier source of income.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem  is a 51-year-old married woman with five children. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, has been running a business buying and selling cloth. She buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Now, she has requested for a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Naseem expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend  part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business.

loans.name: Nurgül

texts.en:
Nurgül is an entrepreneur, married and is 42 years old. She made a business out of her hobby. She designs and makes jewelry at home and sells it from home or from stands. With the help of her second loan from Maya she purchased materials for her jewelry. In the future she is planning to open a workshop and teach other women how to make jewelry.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Nurgül Hanım 42 yaşında evli bir kadın girişimci. Hobi olarak başladığı işini geliştirerek iş fırsatına çevirmiş. Kendine özgü takı tasarımları olan Nurgül hanım yaptığı takıları evinde ve stantlarda satıyor. Maya'dan 2. kredisini kullandı ve bu kredilerle takı malzemesini toptan aldı. Gelecekte takı tasarım atölyesi açarak yaptığı ürünlerini diğer kadınlarında öğrenmesini istiyor.

loans.use: to buy materials

loans.name: Asrah

texts.en:
Asrah is a 62-year-old widowed woman with six children, and has been running a business selling milk for many years. She has buffaloes for milking. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. 

Asrah has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation, and now, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales.

loans.name: Rasoolan

texts.en: Rasoolan is a 52-year-old vigorous, married woman. She has had a business of hand embroidery for many years.  She knows the art of making beautiful embroidery patterns with beads and pearls. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband does not earn enough to support his family well alone. Rasoolan’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best-earning resource in her household. She is a mother of seven children. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand time after time to gain more profits for fulfilling her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand time after time

loans.name: Barkat

texts.en:
Barkat is a 58-year-old widowed woman and a mother of four children. 

In order to support the needs of her family members she began the business of selling milk. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking and is happily supporting her family with the income generated. Barkat has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 55-year-old, married, vigorous lady. She is a mother of 7 children. 

Zubaida has been manufacturing carpets for many years to contribute to the family income along with her husband, who is also shown in the photo. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors and designs to the people of her community, and she makes enough to lead a decent life. 

For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales of handmade carpets

loans.name: Subhra

texts.en:
Subhra is 26 years old and a resident of Alipurduar.  She is married and a mother of one daughter. Subhra studied up to grade nine and could not continue further due to her family's poor economic resources. Her husband, Dipankar, is associated with a small business. 

Subhra is engaged in a cosmetics business to help her husband financially.  She sells different cosmetics like powder, creams, soaps etc. to her neighbours and in nearby villagers.

Now to expand her business, she has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase a large stock of toiletries such as cosmetics, shampoo, soap, hair oil etc.  Her neighbours are her regular customers and she will sell her products to the local community. She hopes to have a good profit from her business as there is no good cosmetics store nearby. 

Her main desire is to educate her daughter at a renowned school for her secure life.

She is thankful to her lenders BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of cosmetics for her existing business.

loans.name: Vache

texts.en:
Vache is 45 years old and lives with his family and his retired mother in Vanadzor city, in the Lori region. 

Vache has a higher pedagogical education and for ten years he has worked at the local school as a teacher of military skills. He is a very respected and beloved teacher in the school and as he likes to say, he does his best to teach his pupils, no matter girl or boy, to be patriots, to be devoted to their motherland and understand that there is no better place in the world than their own land. 

With this loan, Vache wants to buy new professional literature and also a computer. He wants to give more information to his pupils especially about our national heroes, who have very interesting and bright biographies, and who did so much for their nation.

loans.use: for the purchase new professional literature and also a computer.

loans.name: Maka

texts.en:
Maka is 37 years old and is married with two children, a 7-year-old son and a 5-year-old daughter. Her primary job is at a ministry. 

Maka comes from the village of Gejeti in Western Georgia. The subtropical climate in that region, near the Black Sea is ideal for fruit cultivation. Producing hazelnuts and other fruits has a long tradition and is an important economic factor. After exports to Russia had declined due to the Soviet Union collapse, the marked has recovered in recent years. Maka is experienced, because she has already cultivated hazelnuts on rented land. 

With the help of the loan, she will be able to buy her own plot in Gejeti and plant trees on it. Her parents live nearby and are glad to help look after the trees in order to support their daughter. Selling the nuts will generate additional family income.

loans.use: to buy land and cultivate hazelnuts for increased family income.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to have a big store within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a wholesale business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with three children. 

Elizabeth describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells cooking gas, and she has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the KES 98,000 loan to buy more gas cylinders. 

Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will open other business outlets. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more gas cylinders.

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit, her husband and little daughter (in the photo) live in Nizami village of Ararat region. While her husband works as laborer-distributor, Lilit has been running their family farm for many years. 

Near the house where they live, Lilit cultivates potato. She has a lot of work to do in the household, but she also perfectly manages land cultivation works. Lilit has now applied for this loan to purchase four piglets, forage for feeding the livestock and potato seeds. 

As this is Lilit's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Lilit get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses. She hopes for the lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for four piglets, forage for feeding the livestock and potato seeds.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 48-years-old married woman with three children. She has been running a business selling milk for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffaloes for milking purposes, and sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. Tahira is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. 

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation, and now she has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.name: Yasemin

texts.en:
Yasemin is married and a mother of two. One and a half years ago, she became an Amway representative with the recommendation from a friend.  She is contributing to the family budget for the expenses of her children's school needs. At first, she had difficulties in finding customers but by making door-to-door visits, she has increased the number of her customers and overcome the difficulties. Yasemin is planning to purchase Amway products in bulk with the help of her first loan from Maya, thus increasing her profit.  In the future, she wants to promote and become a group leader. Her dream is to enable her children to have a good future.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Yasemin hanım evli iki çocuk annesi.  Bir buçuk yıl önce aile bütçesine katkı sağlamak,çocuklarının okul ihtiyaçlarını sağlamak için bir arkadaşının tavsiyesi ile Amwey(temizlik malz.) ürünleri satmaya başlamış.  İlk başlarda müşteri  bulmada ürünlerini satmada sıkıntılar yaşasa da dolaşarak, çevre imkanlarını kullanarak sıkıntılarını aşmış.  Yasemin hanımın ilk kredisi.  Aldığı kredi ile Amway ürünleri alacak.  Toplu ürün alarak satışını ve karını arttırmayı düşünüyor.  İleride işinde grup lideri olmak istiyor.  Çocuklarına iyi ve güzel bir gelecek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy Amway products in bulk

loans.name: Mahnaz

texts.en:
Mahnaz is a 45-year-old married lady who has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  

She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To fully stock her store, she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR which she will use to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates. This will make more stock available for her customers and she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. 

Mahnaz wishes to spend part of her revenue on providing a good quality life for her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates, in order to make more stock available for her customers.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is 33 years old. Her great skill in hand embroidery has given her a very good reputation in her community. Over time, the demand for her hand embroidered cloth has grown and she uses the income generated to pay for the expenses of her three children. 

Sumaira has now requested a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread, wool, embroidery scissors, frames and tracing paper to meet customers’ demands on time so she can earn a good income.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, wool, embroidery scissors, frames and tracing paper to meet customers’ demands on time.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is 43 years old and the mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a vegetable seller. He sells vegetables such as onion, potato, corn, etc. Her husband is solely responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Jamila’s husband needs to purchase different types of vegetables for reselling so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to unfavorable financial circumstances her husband is not in a position to purchase vegetables for his business.

Jamila has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for her husband's vegetable-selling business.

loans.name: Ingri Patricia

texts.es:
Ingri es madre soltera de dos hijos a quienes les garantiza una buena calidad de vida gracias a su negocio con el cual intenta generar ingresos para contribuir económicamente, para que en su hogar mejoren las condiciones económicas y puedan tener una vida plena. 

Desde hace 2 años comenzó con gran esfuerzo un negocio de droguería en un local ubicado en el municipio de Sincelejo.

Trabaja con 1 familiar empleado durante 8 horas todos los días.

Debido a que sus clientes están aumentando y cada vez demandan más productos, Ingri busca un préstamo para comprar surtido de medicamentos que le hacen falta y ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad de productos en su negocio.
Con este préstamo la actividad de Ingri tendrá un gran impulso pues mejorara su inventario y sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ingri is a single mother of two children.  Her business allows her to guarantee them a better quality of life.  She plans to generate income to contribute to the economy, and to improve the economic conditions in her home so that her family can live a full life.  

She established a pharmacy 2 years ago through great effort.  It is located in the town of Sincelejo.  She works with one family-member employee for 8 hours every day.  

Since her clients are increasing and need more and more products every day, Ingri is seeking a loan to buy a stock of medications that she needs and to offer her clients a greater variety of products.

This loan will give Ingri's business a big push forwards since it will allow her to improve her inventory and sales.

loans.use: to buy a supply of medications that she needs and to offer her clients a larger variety of products in her business

loans.name: Katherine Milagros

texts.es: Katherine es una mujer emprendedora exitosa de 22 años, casada y madre de un hijo, quien es su principal motivación, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace tres años, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de camisas, chores, faldas, pantalones y perfumes Arabela, uno de sus sueños es lograr poner su propia tienda de ropa.
texts.en: Katherine is 22 years old and a successful and enterprising woman. She is a mother to one son who is her greatest motivation. Katherine has been making a living selling second-hand clothing for three years. She will use this loan to buy shirts, shorts, skirts, trousers, and Arabela brand perfumes. One of Katherine’s dreams is to open her own clothes shop.

loans.use: to buy shirts, shorts, skirts, trousers, and Arabela brand perfumes.

loans.name: Mónica Margarita

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Vista Al Mar se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía muy variada y muchos atractivos turísticos que atraen al turista nacional o extranjero.
En este lugar vive la señora Monica, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 21, 17, 12 y 4 años que estudian en universidad, colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Mónica  realiza el crédito para que su marido lo utilice en su negocio, el se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado por libras o al por mayor, el se desplaza hasta las playas de la localidad lugares en el cual compra a muy buen precio, luego se traslada a varias empresas de la ciudad en las cuales entrega al por mayor y también recorre la ciudad en su carro vendiendo por libras ya que así le dejan más ganancias, trabaja todos los días en esta actividad por más de 14 años, actividad que les ha permitido salir adelante con un trabajo duro y honrando. 
Este crédito es para comprar pescado. Lleva 8 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten ayudar a su marido a salir adelante. Sus sueños son darles la mejor educación a sus hijos y que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
The Vista al Mar loan group meets every fortnight in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that are visited throughout the year, for its varied gastronomy, and for its many attractions that bring in both domestic and international tourists.

And it is here that 38-year-old Monica lives. She is married and has four children, ages 21, 17, 12 and 4 years. They are all studying in university, high school and primary school, while Monica’s husband is a trader.

Monica is applying for this loan for her husband to use at his business. He makes a living buying and selling fish by the pound and in bulk. He travels to the local beaches where he buys the product at a very good price before heading to various businesses around the city where he delivers the product in bulk. He also goes around the city with his car selling the fish by the pound. It is in this second work that he earns higher profits. Monica’s husband has been working every day for more than 14 years. The work has allowed the family to get ahead in life by earning a hard but honest living.

This loan will be used to buy fish. Monica has been in the loan group for eight years and she likes it because the loans have helped her husband to do better. Monica’s dreams are to give her children the best possible education and for them to be good people.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en: Pascal is 53 years old. He is married with 1 child, aged 20 years who goes to school. He sells metals for building and he is in business for the past 15 years while his wife is a business woman. With the loan, he would like to buy more metals to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a car for his business. In the future, he aims to earn at least 700,000 per month.

loans.use: to buy more metals to sell.

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en: Hayat  is 45 years old, a married woman doing the business of animal purchasing and selling with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life.  She is very motivated to provide her family with a better standard of living. She has requested a loan of 55 000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount  to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater for more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater for more customers.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred is 52 years old. He is married with 2 children aged 15 and 18 years They all go to school. He sells construction materials for building and he has been in business for the past 6 years while his wife is a business woman. With the loan, he would like to buy more construction materials to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a car for his business. In the future, he aims to earn at least 300,000 per month.

loans.use: to buy more construction materials to sell.

loans.name: Mgwirizano Wa Amai Group

texts.en:
Agnes is 32 years, married with three children and looks after two orphans. Wanting to alleviate poverty in her household,while her sources of funds are low, Agnes started selling fish to people in her surrounding community. 

She also started this business in order to pay school fees for her children. She will use the loan to expand her business by purchasing more fish. She plans to send her children to better schools and hopes to provide her family with adequate basic needs.

loans.use: to buy fish so she can expand her business and afford school fees

loans.name: Chinwendu

texts.en:
Chinwendu is 28 years old and newly married. Annually Chinwendu purchases palm kernels from different local mills to further process it for the market. She has been into this trade for 6 years. Her major challenge is capital and that is why her and her husband decided to join Nke-Anyi Cooperative to enable her opportunity to access credit. 

This is her only source of livelihood and with more capital she will purchase more kernels at a time. More profit is certain with bulk purchase and also transportation cost is also reduced. Chinwendu is very much excited with this program been her first ever loan, she has set all plans to see that she succeeds with it. 

She thanks all Kiva lenders who take their time to read through her profile and also contribute to her loan.

loans.use: A loan of 50,000 Naira will help Chinwendu purchase palm kernels for milling and oil production

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a single woman, with 1 child. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a busy area. 

She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Tulganoy

texts.en:
Tulganoy is one of the residents of Vakhsh district. She is a responsible woman, 52 years old, and a good mother of 6 children. Her husband and four sons are in the Russia. They work there as a migrant worker. The other children help Tulganoy in her work. 

For the 10th year Tulganoy is engaged in animal husbandry. She has a very big experience in her work. She is involved in crop production too. Thus Tulganoy provides for her family. Now she wants to obtain a loan in order expand her activity and purchase e few heads of livestock. Currently she has only one cow. Tulganoy really relies on your help.

loans.use: To expand her activity and purchase a few heads of livestock

loans.name: Asya

texts.en:
Asya is from Dashtavan village where she lives with her husband and two daughters. Together with her whole family, Asya is involved in farming. 
They keep a cow, two calves and cultivate cucumber, tomato, onion, greens and grass. Agricultural products that they get is used both for selling and for family use. 
Asya has now applied for this loan to ask lenders to support their farming business. She plans to purchase  two piglets, fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for land cultivation. 

 As this is Asya's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Asya get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses. She hopes for the lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for two piglets, fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for land cultivation to develop farming business

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a 43-year-old woman, and mother of 4 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a bakery, where he sells different types of eatable items e.g cake, pastries, juices, bread and etc. Her husband is only responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Martha's husband needs to purchase different types of eatables and other items for his business purpose, so that her husband can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in a condition to purchase these items for his business purpose.

Therefore Martha has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purpose. 
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: her husband wants to increase his bakery business

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is 49 years old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. With her four sons, her children are studying. Her husband has been running his own business of clothes selling for 7 years and is esponsible to feed the entire family and manage the house hold. 

Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore Farzana is applying for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Farzana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: her husband wants to increase his clothing business

loans.name: Paulina

texts.pt:
Senhora Paulina tem 42 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 5 filhos dos quais 2 estudam frequentando o ensino primário, é negociante, vive em casa própria com os seus filhos e seu esposo o qual ajuda no sustento da casa.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de frangos, caldos, batata, peixe, para revender na sua banca.
No futuro pretende construir mercearia visto que agora não tem espaço adequado para deixar os produtos.
A exiguidade de fundos torna seus projectos menos céleres, assim sendo vai liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora de modo a garantir futuros financiamentos.
texts.en:
Paulina is 42 years old, married and a mother to five children, two of whom study at primary school. She is a business woman and lives in her own home with her children and her husband who helps her to provide for the family home.

The money from her loan will go towards purchasing chicken, broth, potatoes and fish to resell at her stall. In the future Paulina plans to build a grocery store since she doesn't have enough space at the moment for her products.

As a scarcity of funds can delay her projects, Paulina will pay off her loan without falling behind to guarantee that she will be granted loans in the future.

loans.use: to buy chicken, broth, potatoes and fish to resell at her stall

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina is 47 years old and she has 3 sons, two of them are independent.   Victorina is in the clothing business and lives in a very uncomfortable place (only two rooms).  She needs a loan to buy clothes for her business.  

Victorina is alone, she is not married and she needs your help because she is the only person that supports her family . Her sons are adults and can t help her because they have their own expenses, so Victorina hopes you can help her.  She is healthy and she is responsible

loans.use: to buy clothes for her business

loans.name: Moraima De Jesus

texts.es:
Moraima es una microempresaria dedicada y trabajadora, su campo de acción es la costura.
Todo comenzó hace muchos años cuando decidió a iniciar con este negocio impulsada por la necesidad económica; hoy en día, a sus 54 años de edad, ya tiene su propio taller; trabaja todos los días y su fortaleza es la fabricación de pantalones y camisas de uniformes; de esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.

El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de insumos como tela e hilos, con el fin aumentar la producción y adquirir nuevos contratos, que permitan darle continuidad a su microempresa.

Moraima sueña con tener un negocio sostenible en el tiempo.
texts.en:
Moraima is a dedicated and hardworking micro-entrepreneur. She works in the field of sewing.
It all began many years ago when she decided to start this business due to financial need. Now, at 54 years of age, she has her own workshop. She works everyday and her strength is making trousers and tops for uniforms. In this way she earns sufficient resources to support her husband with the household expenses. 

The loan that she is applying for will be invested in buying supplies such as fabric and threads in order to increase production and acquire new contracts which will allow her to continue with her small business.

Moraima dreams of having a business that is sustainable over time.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fabric and threads in order to increase production and acquire new contracts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a Solar Home Power Solution for her business and wants to increse her productive hours

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 31 years old married man, living in Bazaria village near Nablus City.  Mohammad has 2 young children. His primary income comes from being a full time employee in the government sector and he used to work as a part time employee in the food sector. 

Mohammad hopes to have his own restaurant and coffee shop, so he required a loan from ACAD in order to continue restructuring his own business in the field which he likes.  Mohammad future plan is to expand his business and make his primary income comes from his own business. The main challenge that Mohammad faces is to market his business as it is still new and unknown restaurant.
Mohammad thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to construct a new restaurant

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Ten years ago, Grace started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Mitunguu, a remote village in the Nkubu area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother sells milk, eggs and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Dairy farming is close to her heart and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, her cows are not producing maximum output of milk. She is kindly requesting for a loan to buy a chaff cutter. A chaff cutter is a mechanical device that is used in cutting hay into smaller pieces before being mixed with other forages for better feeding of the cow. Through the loan her cow will never reject any part of the food. Through the loan her cows will increase their milk output hence more income from milk selling. Grace waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter to get improved feeding of her cattle

loans.name: Melina

texts.en:
Melina is from Lehvaz village of Syunik region where she is engaged in farming business. She lives with her husband and 25-years-old son, who support Melina with farming activities. 
They keep livestock of two cows, piglets and twenty chickens. Realizing how important is income gathered from agribusiness for the family's living, Melina has applied for this loan. She plans to purchase a cow and one mother pig. 

Melina has now applied for this loan to ask lenders to support her with purchasing more cattle for her farm. Melina hopes to purchase two cows and two pigs. 

This is Melina's second loan. Unfortunately, the first loan, which she got from a local financial institutions, was very difficult to pay back, and Melina faced some difficulties. However, thanks to her recent hard work, she and her husband have been able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover monthly payments. So, Melina has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and one mother pig to increase income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more petrol [fuel] to sell to customers

loans.name: Mwambo Group

texts.en: A single mother with two children, Violet sells second hand clothes to people surrounding her community. She started this business in order to find adequate funds for supporting her family and relatives. Violet would like to obtain a loan in order to buy more bales of second hand clothes, as this will help her to successfully increase her profits.  She dreams of starting another business in order to at least have two sources of funds,  so she can fully support her family. The previous loans have helped Violet to provide food and clothing to her children.

loans.use: to buy bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: St. Mary's Seminary

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Charles. He is the Vice Rector of St. Mary's Seminary School, a Boys school in the Rural area of Kabarole with 250 students. St. Mary's School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St. Mary's Seminary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Charles ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga, her husband and her parents-in-law live in Vanadzor town. They all are occupied in farming activities. In the farm, they cultivate eleven cows, nine calves, and hens. Each of them has a very important function, especially during harvesting time.

Olga now asks for this loan to purchase four tires for the agro machine and to purchase a truck for the transportation of products to market.

This loan will greatly relieve the work of this family. As this is Olga's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First Chance loan program provides loans to people who haven't had access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Olga get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses. She hopes for the lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for four tires for the agro machine and to purchase a truck for the transportation of products to market.

loans.name: Kagote School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Benon. He is the Director of Studies at Kagote Seed Secondary School, a mixed school in the rural area of Kabarole with 420 students. Kagote School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Kagote School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Benon ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Vista Al Mar se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía muy variada y muchos atractivos turísticos que atraen al turista nacional o extranjero.
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Ana es una mujer que le gusta ser independiente y ganarse sus propios recursos, ella junto a sus hijos hace tres años atrás arrendaron un local en una zona de mucha diversión en la ciudad, instalaron un bar y karaoke, trabajan de miércoles a domingo, días en que son mejores para el negocio y que les permite obtener mejores ganancias, allí venden toda clase de bebidas y bocadillos de picar,  ella también le da una parte del crédito a su esposo el cual lo utiliza en la compra y venta de pescado que es la actividad que el siempre a realizado y con al cual saco adelante a su familia.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar bebidas para surtir el bar karaoke y pescado para su marido. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace más de 3 años y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella empezó  su negocio. Sus sueños  son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
The credit group Vista Al Mar meets every two weeks in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches which are frequented throughout the year, as well as its varied gastronomy and tourist attractions that draw both domestic and international tourists.

Ana lives in this place. She is 53 years old, married, and from this relationship she has four grown children, two of whom still live at home. Her husband is a retailer.

Ana is a woman who likes to be independent and earn her own way. Together with her children, three years ago she rented business premises in a part of the city that is a lot of fun. They put in a karaoke bar and work from Wednesday to Sunday, which are the best days for the business and the ones that allow them to get the best profit.  They sell all sorts of beverages and snacks there. She also gives part of the loan to her husband which he uses in the purchase and sale of fish, that is the work he has always done and with which he has always provided for his family. 

She is going to use his loan to purchase beverages to stock the karaoke bar and fish for her husband. She has been in the credit group for the past three years and she likes it because, thanks to the loans, she started her business. Her dream is to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase beverages and fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereal for resale and a milk freezer.

loans.name: Urpis De Confraternidad Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “URPIS DE CONFRATERNIDAD”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alicia, la socia continua con su  negocio de ferreteria, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo pinturas, clavos entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar mercadería como brochas, pinturas entre otros.
Los socios se sienten  agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron  permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “URPIS DE CONFRATERNIDAD” village bank. This bank is located in Cusco district, belonging to Cusco province and Cusco department.

The member is Alicia. The member continues with her hardware business. The member is a responsible and earnest person. The member continues selling paintings, nails, among others for all of her customers who order from her, this being the manner that the member gets her family ahead.

The member is applying for the loan to buy merchandise like brushes, paintings, among others.

The members feel thankful for the loan granted and they commit themselves to comply with its established payment installments.

The members that appear in the photo alongside asked for permission to arrive late to the meeting because of work.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like brushes, paintings, among others.

loans.name: Khabiba

texts.ru:
Хабиба жительница района Турсунзаде, начала свою животноводческую деятельность 15 лет назад. С тех пор она разводит барашек у себя дома для продажи. Ее муж помогает Хабибе в ведении животноводства. 
Хабиба в возрасте 53 лет, имеет одного 25 летного сына. Сын женат и имеет детей. Она заботливая мать, жена и бабушка. Хабиба энергичная и опытная женщина. Она успевает и в ведении домашнего и сельского хозяйства. В данный момент Хабиба хочет увеличить поголовье своих барашек. Для этой цели она запрашивает кредит, так как собственных средств не хватает. На сумму кредита Хабиба планирует купить несколько голов молодых овец и барашек. Она надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Khabiba is a resident of Tursun-zoda, and started her work in animal husbandry 15 years ago. Up until now, she has been raising lambs at home for sale. Khabiba's husband helps her in her work.
Khabiba is 53 years old, and has one 25 year-old son. Her son is married and has children. She is a caring mother, wife and grandmother. Khabiba is an energetic and experienced woman. She manages both her home and her farm. At the moment, Khabiba wants to expand her total number of lambs. In order to do this, she is asking for a loan, as she doesn't currently have the funds. With the loan, Khabiba plans to buy several young sheep and lambs. She hopes for your support.

loans.use: To buy young sheep and lambs to expand her  herd.

loans.name: Nixson

texts.es:
Nixson, mayor de edad casado y con 2 hijos, originario de La Dorada, es un microempresario administrador y propietario de su propio negocio el cuale consiste en la compra y venta de ropa nueva el cual lo realiza ambulante y también en su casa, 
Se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, también con muchos deseos de superación personal, tiene clientes tanto al crédito como al contado que recupera quincenal o mensualmente.

Inicio este negocio con fondos propios debido a la necesidad de trabajar y el deseo de mejorar los ingresos en su hogar, tuvo el compromiso de salir adelante con el esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo que ha realizado durante 6 años en el cual ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma, uno de sus sueños es poder llegar a tener un gran negocio. 

Desde muy temprano ella se levanta a abrir su venta para empezar a vender y poder sacar adelante a su familia. Nixson es un hombre que se caracteriza por ser emprendedor, trabajador y responsable con todos sus compromisos adquiridos, ha venido poco a poco mejorando su negocio. 

El objetivo de este crédito es para poder comprar más mercadería como; zapatos, ropa interior, cosméticos, productos plásticos entre otros etc. 

Nixson se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo económico que Kiva le brinda a las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en:
Nixson, of age and married with two children, native to La Dorada, is a microentrepreneur, manager, and owner of his own business which consists of buying and selling new clothes, which he does on foot and also in his house.

He is characterized by being a very hardworking and responsible man, he also has a lot of desire of personal growth. He has both credit and cash customers whom he bills every 15 days or monthly.

He started this business with his own funds due to the necessity of working and the dream of improving the income in his home. He had the commitment of getting ahead with effort and continuous work that he's carried out for 6 years, in which he's demonstrated his responsibility of paying in a timely manner. One of his dreams is to be able to arrive at having a large business.

Since very early, he gets up to open his sales to start selling and be able to get his family ahead. Nixson is a man who is characterized by being an entrepreneur, worker and responsible with all of his acquired commitments. He's gone improving his business little by little.

The goal of this loan is to be able to buy more merchandise like: shoes, underwear, cosmetics, plastic products, among others.

Nixson feels very thankful for the economic support that Kiva provides to the people most in need.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise like: shoes, underwear, cosmetics, plastic products, among others.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith es una mujer con todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar el mundo y tener una vida plena gracias a sus esfuerzos.
Tiene un almacén en el que vende ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, accesorios, entre otros. Inicio el negocio hace 30 años y ha tenido buena acogida en el sector.

Ella desea ampliar su oferta de productos y mejorar sus ventas inyectándole capital a su empresa, es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para darse la oportunidad de ser mas prospera. 

El dinero será invertido en la compra de mercancía con la que actualmente no cuenta como ropa de marca y colecciones nuevas, perfumería, entre otros.

Tiene grandes esperanzas en su negocio y piensa que su futuro puede mejorar considerablemente gracias al apoyo de entidades como Interactuar que hacen lo posible para que las personas puedan soñar con una vida mejor y más estable.
texts.en:
Judith is a women with all of her batteries plugged in to face the world and have a full life thanks to her efforts. She has a warehouse where she sells clothing, shoes, cosmetics, accessories, among others. She started this business 30 years ago and has had a good reception in the sector. 

She wishes to grow her offering of products and improve her sales, injecting capital into her business. It's for this reason that she's applying for a loan to give herself the opportunity to be more prosperous.

The money will be invested in the purchase of merchandise with which she currently doesn't have like brand name clothing and new collections, perfumes, among others.

She has great hopes for her business and thinks that her future can improve considerably thanks to the support of entities like Interactuar that do all that is possible for the people who can dream of a better and more stable life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise with which she currently doesn't have like brand name clothing and new collections, perfumes, among others.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлуба 42 летняя жена и мать 5 детей. Она жительница района Н.Хусрав. Детям 21, 19, 16, 10 и 7 лет. Ее муж находится на заработках загранице, чтобы зарабатывать и прокормить детей. Матлуба 25 лет своей жизни занимается учительнице в средней школе. Каждый человек вспоминает свою любимую учительницу с улыбкой. Ее ученики всегда вспоминают с улыбкой, потому что у нее открытая душа, милая улыбка и большой жизненный опыт. Матлуба параллельно занимается животноводством уже 16 лет. И занимается до сих пор. Матлуба много мечтала о расширение своего бизнеса и о покупке нового скота. В данный момент вести хозяйство ей помогают старшие дети. Матлуба просит кредит для купли скота и расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Matluba is a 42 year old wife and mother of 5 children. She is a resident of Nosiri Khusrav. Her children are 21, 19, 16, 10 and 7 years old. Her husband works abroad, in order to earn money to feed their children. Matluba has spent 25 years of her life working as a teacher at a middle school. Every person remembers their favorite teacher with a smile. Her lessons are remembered with fondness, because she has an open soul, a kind smile and great life experience. Matluba has also worked in animal husbandry for 16 years alongside this, and still does now. Matluba has dreamed about expanding her business and about buying new cattle. At the moment, her oldest children help her with the farm. Matluba is asking for a loan to buy cattle and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cattle and expand her business.

loans.name: Kakha

texts.en:
Kakha is a 45-year-old married man. He lives in a small village in Rokhi district with his wife, two children, and father. Kakha works as a security guard and gets 400 GEL monthly. The family also has two cows and produces cheese to sell locally. In addition, they own a vineyard and produce wine for family use only. 

Kakha has requested a loan to start a poultry business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 2,000 USD. With the received credit he will purchase chicks and feed for them, raise them, and sell them. This will increase the family income, and with increased income Kakha will be able to improve the living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en:
Amadu is a Babban Gona farmer from Badamasi Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realize better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Amadu no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to expand his farm. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Amadu will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicide, and improved seeds that will help him improve his yields to up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. His loan will help to considerably increase his income. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Amadu now has the opportunity to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs to increase his yields

loans.name: Laazarus

texts.en:
Laazarus is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gwani Village. He joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Laazarus suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Laazarus will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizer, herbicide, and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare which is double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags per hectare. His loan will help him increase his  household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Laazarus now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs to increase yields

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samson is a hard-working man with a knack for sales. He's working for iSmart Kenya as a salesman where he sells green products like solar lamps and clean-burning cookstoves door-to-door in Nairobi's slum communities. He wants to earn a living so that he can be self-sufficient and help support his family. Please support him so that he can purchase products to sell and earn an honest living.

loans.use: to pay for clean cookstoves to sell in informal settlements in Nairobi.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en: Doreen is working as a sales agent for iSmart Kenya. She's holding a clean-burning cookstove, an incredible product that reduces charcoal consumption by half, saving her customers money that they can spend on other important things like food, healthcare, or school fees. These cookstoves also reduce toxic emissions, benefiting women and girls who most often bear the burden of cooking. Please help Doreen earn a living bringing these beneficial products to others in her community.

loans.use: to pay for green energy products to sell in informal settlements in Nairobi.

loans.name: Margherita School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is David. He is the Director of Margherita Nursery and Primary School, a mixed school in the rural area of Kasese with 750 students. The school does not currently have consistent access to clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system would therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. 

David is requesting a loan for the Margherita School to cover the cost of installing an maintaining two UV water filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for students. The loan will enable the school to purchase treatment systems with two 450 liter tanks that which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. Margherita School will repay its loan from its school fees, which are collected each term. David ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for students

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is a sales agent working for iSmart Kenya, an organization with a mission to create jobs for youth and women in slums. Benson has completed iSmart's sales and marketing training and is working as a door-to-door sales agent in Nairobi's slum communities. iSmart's best-selling product is the clean cookstove, which has an efficient design that saves customers money by reducing the amount of charcoal needed by half. These cookstoves also reduce the toxic smoke emissions and are better for the customer's health, as well as the environment.  Please help Benson earn a living and bring these beneficial products to others in his community.

loans.use: to pay for clean cookstoves to sell in informal settlements in Nairobi.

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Малика родилась в 1986 году. Она живет в небольшом районе под названием Дж.Руми. Малика  замужняя женщина. У нее трое детей. В течение примерно 8 лет, Малика и ее муж занимается бизнесом. У Малике есть пекарня, где она печет хлеб. Малика печет вкусный и традиционный хлеб. Ее муж продает хлеб на рынке. Она имеет много клиентов. Ее хлеб хорошо известен и знаменит своими вкусами и запахами. Малика  нуждается в муки и дрова. Она просит кредит, чтобы купить муки и дрова, чтобы испечь хлеб и продвигать деятельность. Малику очень нужно Ваша помощь.
texts.en: Malika was born in 1986. She lives in a small region called J. Rumi. Malika is a married woman, and she has three children. Over the course of 8 years, Malika and her husband have been running a business. Malika has a bakery, where she bakes bread. Malika bakes tasty and traditional bread. Her husband sells the bread at the market. She has many customers, and her bread is well known for its taste and smell. Malika is in need of flour and firewood. She is asking for a loan in order to buy these items, so she can bake bread and promote her work. Malika needs your help very much.

loans.use: To buy flour and firewood.

loans.name: Ana Maria's Group

texts.en:
Ana Maria is a single mother who maintains and raises her three children by herself.  Ana Maria lives with her children in the locality of Benito Juarez, which it is in the municipality of Tuxpan in the state of Veracruz. Ana Maria works as a house cleaner, although her work is not far from her house she comes home late. 

Nowadays she lights her house with candles, witch do not illuminate well and are unhealthy because of the daily smoke inhalation.  Ana Maria wants to purchase a solar system to light better her house, and with this her children will be able to do their homework and will be safe after the dark while Ana stills working.

loans.use: to purchase a solar system to replace the use of candles and with this their children will be able to do their homework.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks and cement to constuct a house

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro has his own house and he earns money by driving a car. He is married and his wife sells food. The couple lives with their kids.

Pedro needs a loan to repair his house, which, as you can see in the picture, is not completed and needs a lot of work. Pedro's wife is in charge of the kids, so the repairs at the house are Pedro's responsibility. He hopes you can help him. He is healthy and he wants to improve his family's quality life.

loans.use: to repair his house

loans.name: Roxana

texts.en:
Roxana lives at her parents house and has a 9-year-old son. She sells fast food such as hamburgers, hot dogs, and other kinds of food. 

Roxana cooks every day and she needs a loan to buy cow and chicken meat for her business. That will be very helpful for her because it will allow her to cook and sell more. Roxana supports her parents and she also has to take care of her son. She hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to buy cow and chicken meat for her business

loans.name: Wilson

texts.pt:
Senhor Wilson tem 39 anos de idade, solteiro e pai de 1 filha frequentando ensino primário, e docente e estudante universitário, vive em casa própria e sustenta uma sobrinha.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de cimento, varões, estribos, para dar continuidade a construção da sua casa, visto que vive na mesma mas ainda esta em construção.
No futuro pretende construir um aviário para iniciar a criação de frangos visto que tem experiencia nesta área, e consequentemente aumentar a renda familiar.
O seu maior e de defender a sua licenciatura de modo a mudar de careira no serviço e ganhar salário razoável.
texts.en:
Wilson is 39 years old, single and a father to a daughter who goes to primary school. He is a teacher and a university student, lives in his own home and supports his niece. 

The money from this loan will go towards buying cement, rods and steps to continue the construction work on his house where he lives even though it is under construction. In the future Wilson would like to build an aviary to start raising chickens as he has experience in this area. As a result this will increase his family's income. 

Wilson's greatest challenge is to obtain his degree so he can move to a career in the public service where he can earn a decent salary.

loans.use: to buy cement, rods and steps to continue the construction work on his house

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is a hard-working and diligent mother. She has never tired of supporting her family, especially her grandchildren. Diosdada is engaged in a snack vending business, selling assorted cakes. Her business is doing well and she doubles her time perfecting the taste and quality of her products. Diosdada has maximized her profits and kept pursuing her goals for the good of her family.

Diosdada has taken out another loan from PMPC to buy additional raw ingredients for her cakes to serve more customers and be able to meet catering orders. She hopes and prays that her business will grow and that she will make another snack recipe to increase sales to continuously benefit her family, especially her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients for her cakes to serve more customers and be able to meet catering orders

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 38 and happily married to one wife. They have five children, ages six, eight, 10, 12 and 14. All of Innocent’s children are in school. He works as a farmer and is a prominent businessman who trades in agricultural products. Innocent is a coffee farmer who also has a banana plantation and he works nine hours a day, six days a week. He started his business in 1998 to generate income for his family household. Most of his clients are people in Rubirizi District. Innocent is a hardworking person whose business challenges include price fluctuations and the high price of farm inputs.

Innocent is requesting a 5,000,000 UGX loan from UGAFODE Microfinance ltd (MDI) to buy more stock of agricultural products such as coffee seedlings to plant, mulch for his plantations, and to complete his leisure gardens.

loans.use: to buy coffee seedlings to plant, mulch, and to complete his garden

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia has a lot of experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities such as growing, caring for, and harvesting crops, and is earning income, as well. Letecia has supported her husband doing this type of work.

Like a farmer, Letecia has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase seedlings, fertilizer, and bags of chicken manure. Someday, Letecia hopes to purchase a parcel of agricultural land to cultivate that will potentially add income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizer, and bags of chicken manure

loans.name: Claudio

texts.en:
Claudio is 61-years-old and lives in Salimpono, Pananon, Misamis Occidental. He is single with no dependents. Claudio earns his living as a chef in one of the eateries in the area. He earns approximately PHP 4,200 each month from doing this type of work. 

Claudio has requested a loan to redeem a parcel of pawned cocoland. He has been a member of PMPC for almost 11 years. In the future, Claudio hopes to establish his own eatery business.

loans.use: To redeem a parcel of pawned cocoland

loans.name: Ely

texts.en:
Ely is 49 years old and resides in Oroquieta City. She is married and she joined PMPC in order to access the programs and services.

Recently, Ely has accessed a new loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 as additional working capital for her existing business and to buy a variety of items, including food products, that she sells in the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of items, including food products, to resell at her store

location.town: Oroquieta-Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Capitine

texts.pt:
O senhor Captine de 31 anos de idade, casado, pai de 1 filho este sem idade escolar comerciante vende carne diversa em regime ambulatório e vive na casa própria.

Com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar, carne de porco, carne de vaca, worse, fígado e dobrada para reforçar o seu negocio.
O cliente tem como sonho, ampliar o seu negocio para responder as necessidades dos seus clientes concluir a sua  casa  para oferecer um lar melhor a sua família.
Os principais desafios são financeiros, pretende fechar rápido o credito para tomar outro para suprir as suas dificuldades e alcançar os objetivos.
texts.en:
Captine is 31 years old, married and a father to one school aged son. He works in trade selling different types of meat as a street vendor and lives in his own home. 

With the money from this loan Captine plans to buy pork, beef, sausages, liver and tripe stew to strengthen his business. This client dreams of expanding his business to respond to his customers' needs and completing work on his house to provide a better home for his family. His main challenges are financial so he plans to repay this loan quickly so he can take out another one to overcome his difficulties and reach his goals.

loans.use: to buy pork, beef, sausages, liver and tripe stew to strengthen his business.

loans.name: Godoberta

texts.en:
Godoberta is 61 years old and married and is from Oroquieta, Philippines. She manages her fishing business and owns a fishing boat. Godoberta and her husband have employed fishermen to work in their fishing business. She personally sells the catch from her fishing boat to the market and neighboring towns. She earns a good income each month doing this type of work, meeting the needs of her family. 

Godoberta has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy diesel gasoline, pay for an engine repair and overhaul, and purchase fishing equipment and accessories. In the future, she hopes to buy another fishing boat to improve and expand her fishing business.

loans.use: to buy diesel gasoline, pay for an engine repair and overhaul, and purchase fishing equipment and accessories

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es:
A sus 47 años de edad Sandra logró consolidar un negocio de confección a terceros y línea propia de ropa gracias a la experiencia que tuvo trabajando en talleres, trabaja de lunes a sábado entre 9 y 11 horas diarias dependiendo la cantidad de trabajo y sabe que gracias a sus clientes tiene buen negocio. 

Quiere ampliar sus horizontes y lograr ofrecer trabajo a las personas más necesitadas por lo que solicita un crédito para la compra de una maquina digital de confección con la que podrá expandirse a nuevas empresas y tener mejor volumen de trabajo dándole la oportunidad a una persona de trabajar. 

Su sueño es seguir creciendo y conformar un taller y así un día contar la historia de que gracias a colaboradores y prestadores del portal Kiva y a la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar pudo montar y crecer un gran negocio.
texts.en:
At age 47, Sandra has been able to combine her business of sewing garments for third parties with creating her own clothing line, thanks to her experience from previous work in tailor shops.

She works between 9 and 11 hours per day, Monday to Saturday, depending on the workload. She knows that she has a good business going thanks to her clients.

She would like to expand her horizons and offer work to those in need of it. She is applying for a loan to buy a digital sewing machine that she will use to expand her business and generate a higher volume of work, thereby creating a work opportunity for another person.

Her dream is to continue growing her business into a tailoring shop, and so one day to tell the story that she was able to set up and build her shop into a great business thanks to the support of the partners and lenders from Kiva and Interactuar.

loans.use: to buy a digital sewing machine so that she can expand her business.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.pt:
A senhora Carolina de 33 anos de idade e casada, comerciante vende roupa usada, mãe de 3 filhos dos quais 1 frequenta o ensino secundário, 1 o ensino primário e o outro ainda sem idade escolar.
Com o valor do credito pretende comprar, roupa usada de crianças, blusas para adultos, calsoes para adultos, vestidos para adultos,  e calcas para homens para ampliar o seu negocio
A cliente tem como sonho,ampliar o seu negocio para responder as necessidades dos seus clientes, construir dependências em sua casa para aumentar a renda familiar e abrir um estabelecimento em casa para vender produtos diversos .
Tem como principais desafios financeiros e a concorrência no mercado mas tem estado a tentar melhorar os seus serviços , esta a fazer xitiques e pretende tomar mais vezes para suprir as dificuldades e alcançar os seus sonhos
texts.en:
