Carolina is 33 years old, married and a trader who sells used clothing. She is a mother to three children of whom one goes to high school, one goes to primary school and the other is not yet school aged.

With the money from this loan Carolina plans to buy used children's clothing, shirts, shorts and tops for adults and pants for men to expand her business.

This client dreams of expanding her business to respond to the needs of her customers, build an outhouse at home to increase her family's income and open a store in her home where she could sell diverse products.

Her main challenges are her finances and the competition in the market but she has been trying to improve her services. She will create a savings support group and plans to take out various loans to overcome her difficulties and reach her goals.

loans.use: to buy used children's clothing, shirts, shorts and tops for adults and pants for men to expand her business.

loans.name: Rustambek

texts.ru: Рустамбек хорошо воспитанный и честный человек. Его характер как у него отца. Рустамбек не боится трудности и работы. Он постоянно двигается вперед. Рустамбек женат и имеет  двое детей. Он воспитывает своих детей, чтобы они стали как он: честным, сильным и ответственным. Его жена домохозяйка. Рустамбек молодой 29 летный житель района Дж.Руми. Он занимается таксистом. Предоставляя услуги такси, он зарабатывает на жизнь. Рустамбек хочет начать новый бизнес. Он решил заниматься купле продажей крупнорогатых скотов. Рустамбек имеет коровник и корм для скота. Ему надо только купить скота и начать новый бизнес. Он давно хотел заниматься животноводством, но у него не было возможности. Рустамбек обратился к Вам за кредитом, чтобы приобрести несколько крупнорогатого скота. Он верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Rustambek is a young 29-year-old resident of the J. Rumy region who earns a living as a taxi driver. He is a well-brought-up and honest person with a character like his father's. He is not afraid of work or of difficulties, but constantly moves forward. He is married with two children whom he is raising so they will become like he is: honest, strong and responsible. His wife is a homemaker.

Rustambek wants to start a new business buying and selling cattle. He has a cow shed and cattle feed and needs only to buy the cattle to start the business. He has wanted to work in animal husbandry for a long time but has never had the resources. He is turning to you for a loan so that he can buy a few head of cattle. He trusts in you and in your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle and start a new business

loans.name: Reshama

texts.en:
Reshama is a 45-year-old housewife who is married to Nathuni and lives in Falakata in Alipurduar district. She is blessed with four children (two sons and two daughters). Two of them are students of grade 2 and 8, and the other two are married. 

Reshama is illiterate but knows how to sign her name. She could not receive education due to poor economic resources of her family.

Her husband keeps himself busy in the stall, selling "panipuri"— a popular street snack. In the Bengali language it is called "phuchka." It consists of a round hollow puri, fried crisp and filled with flavored water. Reshama works hard and manages the household work until night. She prepares "panipuris" at home and her husband sells them to different places in their village. 

As their "phuchka" is in great demand in her area, Reshama wishes to expand the business by purchasing different kinds of essential ingredients such as flour, tamarind, chilly, chat masala, peas, potatoes, etc., to prepare more delicious "phuchka" to attract the customers. So she has requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase the necessary ingredients to increase the productivity, which will enable her to run the business smoothly.

Reshama wishes to get ahead with their existing business as it is a profitable one. She also dreams of giving a better education to her children for a better future.

Reshama is very thankful to BJS and Kiva for their kind support.

loans.use: To purchase more necessary ingredients for her panipuri business.

loans.name: Shifali

texts.en:
Shifali is a young entrepreneur of 30 years. She is married and lives in Paschim Falakata in Alipurduar district. She is the mother of two sons. She lives with her family in their mud and straw made house. Unfortunately, due to lack of economic resources, Shifali was unable to pursue education and remains illiterate. She knows how to sign her name only.

Shifali's husband is a vegetable vendor who sells seasonal vegetables to the local market. As the family has inconsistent income, Shifali decided to start dairy farming. She owns a dairy cow. She sells milk and milk products in her neighborhood and earns for the family.  

As their joint income is still insufficient to cover the basic needs of her family, she would like to improve her business to strengthen the family economy. So she has taken a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase one more dairy cow to grow her dairy business. 

With this new cow she can start producing more milk to sell and satisfy her customers' demands. She is a very enthusiastic and hardworking woman with a great desire to ensure financial stability to her family. Her dream is to buy agricultural land in future with the profit from her business.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her existing milk-selling business.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina is from Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. She is 36 years old and married. Marcelina joined Paglaum MPC in 2010, and she appreciates the co-op's programs and services. For a living, she sells assorted fruits, vegetables and dried fish in different municipalities of Misamis Occidental during "tabo" (market day). She has had this source of income for four years now. As Marcelina needed additional working capital, she requested financial assistance from Paglaum MPC of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more stock of fruits, vegetables and dried fish for resale. Through this purchase, she hopes to increase her income so she is able to provide for her family's daily needs. In the future, she hopes to arrange for a decent house for them as well.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits, vegetables and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is known in his neighborhood as being a hard-working father. He is engaged in fishing activities and labor work to earn income to provide for his family. He became a member of PMPC, and appreciates the various programs and services that the Coop offers. 

He hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house. He applied for a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase "amakan" (bamboo mats), nails, and sticks to repair his house for safe and comfortable living. 

He hopes to maintain his membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that he has been given priority, as a regular member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what he is thankful for, when all his financing needs are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase "amakan" (bamboo mats), nails, and sticks to repair his house.

loans.name: Tachhlima

texts.en:
Tachhlima is a rural woman of 35 years. She is married and blessed with three children (two sons and one daughter). They live in a small village in Falakata, Alipurduar district, West Bengal, in their own kachha house (made of straw, mud and wood). All of their children attend school.

Tachhlima's husband is a mason by profession. But his income is inconsistent because it depends on the availability of work. So they find it hard to depend on his income.

To earn an additional income, Tachhlima has been engaged in her milk-selling business for years. Now, to develop her business, she wants to purchase a dairy cow to raise and sell milk. She thinks it will earn more profit as cow milk has a great demand in her locality.  She runs the household efficiently and manages to save a small amount each week.

Now she is seeking the loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase the dairy cow so that she can develop her milk-selling business. Her main clients are her neighbors. Buying a dairy cow will increase their financial security in the long run because it is an asset they can sell during hard times. Her main challenge is to provide her children proper education, which will be possible through the profit she will earn.

She gives her heartiest thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en: Benita is married and lives in Oroquieta in the Philippines. She joined PMPC in January 2009 in order to access its programs and services. Recently, she took out a loan of additional working capital for her business. She will use the loan to buy a variety of commodities, which she will sell in the local community. Benita wishes to make an adequate income so she can consistently help her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities to sell in her local community

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is from Kauswagan, Plaridel in the Philippines. She is married and her husband is a fisherman. 

Gina manages a small fishing business and owns a fishing boat as well. She earns a good income each month doing this type of work and supports the needs of her family, especially her children's education. 

Gina has requested a loan to purchase 100 litres of diesel gasoline and to pay for an engine overhaul. 

In the future, she hopes to buy another fishing boat to improve and expand her fishing business.

loans.use: to purchase 100 liters of diesel gasoline and to pay for an engine overhaul.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn is a businesswoman who earns through retailing various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement, floor tiles and jalousies to complete her house, which she is on her way to doing. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement, floor tiles and jalousies to complete her house

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie is 65 years old and lives in Sindangan, Philippines. She is a widow with four adult children. She is good at doing her farming activities like vegetable gardening and has had this business for more than a decade. She requested a loan to buy bags of fertilizer and pesticides to get more produce. She recently became a member of Paglaum MPC. In the future, Rosie hopes to venture into a new business to have more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer and pesticides to get more produce

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en:
Angelie is 45 years old and married with eight children. With four children in school, she works very hard to provide for them by running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested an 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Angelie has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soap, noodles and other groceries. In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel is 54 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Anabel is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional pigs and feed.

Anabel has been raising pigs for five years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and feed.

loans.name: Gisela Andrea

texts.es:
Gisela es una persona muy trabajadora que gracias a su esfuerzo diario ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos brindándoles una educación de buena calidad.
Gisela vive en unión libre con su pareja y desde hace mucho tiempo comenzó a vender bolsos, con gran esfuerzo a superado muchos problemas que se le han presentado.

Actualmente Gisela tiene unos muy buenos pedidos por parte de sus clientes y debido a que no cuenta con un gran capital busca un préstamo para comprar surtido de bolsos, maletines y billeteras al por mayor para aumentar su inventario.
Le dedica 8 horas diarias a su negocio.
Su mayor sueño es salir adelante con su negocio y desde este poder ofrecerles a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica, sabe que de la mano de Interactuar podrá lograrlo.
texts.en:
Gisela is an industrious woman who has worked diligently each day and managed to ensure that her children receive a high-quality education. She is married and has long run a business selling handbags, spending eight hours a day at work, and overcoming many challenges that arose through hard work. 

Gisela currently has many orders from customers, but lacks the capital to meet them. She's therefore applying for a loan for the purchase of wholesale handbags, briefcases, and wallets to boost her inventory. 

Gisela's great ambition is to make her business successful and provide her children with an excellent education so they can live a stable life. She knows that help from Interactuar can help her achieve these goals.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale handbags, briefcases, and wallets to boost her inventory.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria started off her career in the healthcare industry as a medical assistant. This mother of three worked long hours, caring for each and every one of her patients. While Maria loved her career, she did not have a flexible schedule. 
  
“Healthcare is something I was proud to do, but I needed a change for my children,” Maria said. “I have always had a passion for artistry, and being a beauty consultant -- making women feel good about who they are -- is something I can be proud of too.”

Maria has two years under her belt as a beauty consultant for Mary Kay. In her two years of services she has made great strides in the beauty industry. Because of her outstanding sales record, she worked her way up to being a director within her Mary Kay region. Becoming a Mary Kay consultant served as a perfect solution for Maria and helped to fuel her own entrepreneurial aspirations.
 
Maria is now the proud owner of Guapi Sales, operating out of Carrollton, Texas.  She will be offering Mary Kay products and make-up consulting. She currently employs one full-time employee and plans to hire one part-time worker later this year. 

She came to LiftFund seeking support for both marketing and inventory. With her loan, Maria will be able to push more products and build marketing pieces such as signage, business cards and flyers for her new business.

loans.use: to provide marketing and inventory for her business.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 58 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ofelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soap, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Ofelia would like to save enough money to expand her business and to improve the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Suparna

texts.en:
Suparna is a hardworking woman of 44 years from Falakata. She is married and a mother of one son who reads in grade 12 in a local school. She has received education till B.A (Bachelor of Arts). She lives at a small village in the district of Alipurduar, West Bengal, India.

Suparna's husband works in a tea garden and she herself sells betel nuts (a kind of mouth freshener used in rural areas of India). After managing her household activities she runs her business properly. She purchases betel nuts from their own villagers and from the neighboring villages and sells to the retailers. 

She wants to improve her family’s livelihood so she needs to expand her existing business by buying more stocks of raw betel nuts. Thus Suparna has applied a loan Kiva's field partner, BJS. 

Her dream is to enhance the business that will enable her family to get ahead, provide a greater opportunity to her son for further education so that he can lead a secured life in the future. She dreams to build a concrete house for her family with the profit generated from her business.

She is grateful to both Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase more raw betel nuts in order to grow her business.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is 39 years old and married with three children. She lives in a rural community near Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

She owns and operates a small general store selling varieties of food items and has been doing this for six years.

Pamela needs a loan to buy food items to restock her goods. She plans to use her profit to meet her family's daily expenses and provide a better standard of living for her family.

She has been an SPBD member since 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, sugar, biscuits, noodles, canned foods and cooking oil for her general store.

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en:
Sopheak, 43, lives in the community of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She has one child. 

To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. She has been in this type of business for fifteen years. On average, she is able to make an income of 5 USD a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of her entire family by having a latrine to use.  At the moment,  there is no latrine in her house. She is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with has a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: América Alegría

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Vista Al Mar se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía muy variada y muchos atractivos turísticos que atraen al turista nacional o extranjero.
En este lugar vive la señora América, tiene 46 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 18 y 11 años que estudian en universidad y escuela. Su esposo es pescador.
Doña América con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos hace 8 años adecuo en su casa un local en el cual vende artículos de bazar y papelería, en esta  época lo que más vende son los útiles escolares razón por lo cual solicita este crédito ya que viene la época de entrada a clases y es cuando más ganancias le quedan, ella también le da una parte del crédito a su marido para que él lo utilice en sus faenas de pesca, el necesita varios materiales que emplea en su labor. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar útiles escolares, redes, piolas y anzuelos para el marido. Lleva 2 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños es que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.
texts.en:
The Vista Al Mar [Ocean View] Communal Bank meets twice a month in the city of Manta, which is known for its rich cuisine and many tourist attractions that draw visitors all year, especially the stunning beaches along the coast. 

Manta is the home of  Señora América, who is 46, married to a fisherman, and the mother of two sons, ages 18 and 11. The older son studies at a university, and the younger one is in middle school. 

Doña América went into business eight years ago so she could earn her own income. She opened a store in her home where she sells paper goods and school supplies. The school year is about to start, so sales will soon increase Doña América needs to boost her inventory. She's therefore applying for a loan o purchase school supplies, as well as supplies for her husband's fishing business: nets, lines, and hooks. She has completed two loan cycles as part of Vista Al Mar, and has been pleased with the fast service and how these loans have benefited her business. She will keep working hard to sustain her store and ensure that her sons can have a good education.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies, as well as fishing nets, lines, and hooks.

loans.name: Merlyn Idalia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Vista Al Mar se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía muy variada y muchos atractivos turísticos que atraen al turista nacional o extranjero.
En este lugar vive la señora Merlyn, tiene 23 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tienen un  hijo de 4 años el cual este año empieza a estudiar en un jardín de infantes de la ciudad. Su esposo trabaja para el municipio local.
Doña Merlyn con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, ella tiene unas vitrinas  en su casa donde exhibe sus prendas, la mayor parte de sus ventas es por pedido ya que ella viaja a Guayaquil a comprar lo que sus clientes le piden, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, lleva más de 5  años en su negocio el cual le permite ganarse algo por su cuenta y así sentirse útil e independiente. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pantalones, camisas, ropa de damas y niños. Lleva 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The Vista Al Mar group meets every 15 days in the city of Manta.  This city is known for its beautiful beaches that are heavily visited throughout the year.  It is also known for its very diverse cuisine and its many tourist attractions that attract native and foreign tourists.

This is where Merlyn, age 23, lives.  She is in a common-law marriage, and they have a four year old son.  This year he starts going to the city kindergarten.  Her husband works for the local municipality.

In order to have her own earnings, Merlyn sells all types of clothes.  She has display cases at her house where she exhibits her garments.  Most of her sales are by order.  She travels to Guayaquil to buy what her customers order.  She gives them credit and collects every eight days.  She has had her business for five years, and it allows her to earn something on her own.  This way she feels useful and independent.

She will use this loan to buy pants, shirts, and clothes for women and children.  She has been in the communal bank for four years.  She likes it because the loans help her a lot.  Her dream is to have a big place.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, and clothes for women and children.

loans.name: Ana Mie

texts.en:
Ana Mie is a hard-working entrepreneur with five children.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs.

Ana Mie dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her dress-making business

loans.name: Henry Manuel

texts.es: Henry de 35 años,  reside en un barrio de Cartagena de Indias, una ciudad situada al norte de Colombia,  en donde su amable gente, siglos de historia, museos, edificaciones centenarias, playas e islas hermosas capturan a cientos de turistas.  Henry decidió colocar una venta de comidas, fritos (pasabocas de masa rellenos de carnes o queso) y bebidas,  al observar que en el sector existía una gran demanda de clientes que a diario llegaban a  lugares dedicados a esta misma actividad para consumir este tipo de alimentos, no dudó de sus capacidades para elaborar jugos naturales, patacones rellenos, empanadas, arepas de huevo y chicharrones.  En la actualidad cuenta con cuatro años de experiencia ofreciendo estos productos a los transeúntes del lugar.  Henry está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en carne, harina, huevos, sal, queso y aceite para la preparación de los fritos e incrementar la oferta de productos.
texts.en:
Henry is a 35 years old and resides in the northern Colombian city of Cartagena de Indias. The city draws flocks of tourists who come to explore its museums and centuries of history, relax on stunning beaches and nearby islands, and enjoy the kindness and hospitality of Cartagena's people. 

Henry saw that there were many tourists who wanted to try Cartagena's regional foods, and set up a small restaurant four years ago. He was confident that he could prepare the fresh juices and regional dishes that locals and visitors wanted to try: empanadas, tortillas filled with eggs and pork rinds, and "patacones rellenos" [fried shells filled with meats and cheese].  

Henry is applying for his first loan, from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. He will use the loan funds for the purchase of meats, flour, eggs, salt, cheese, and cooking oil for the preparation of the dishes on his menu, which he wants expand so he can offer his customers greater variety.

loans.use: to invest in meat, flour, eggs, salt, cheese, and cooking oil for preparing fried foods.

loans.name: Sonabi

texts.en:
Sonabi is a 46-year-old rural woman. She is illiterate and can sign her name only. She lives with her husband and two sons in the small town of Falakata. Her sons have started to contribute to the family due to poverty. They work as drivers. 

Sonabi's husband is a mason by profession but his income is very irregular. Sonabi sells betel nuts to give her family additional support. Betel nut is a kind of mouth freshener that is used by the local people. She knows that the villagers are fond of betel leaves (taken with betel nuts) after their laborious work. So, there is a huge demand of betel nuts in her locality.

As they have no betel nut trees she has to purchase raw betel nuts from the wholesale market and, after removing the shells, she cuts the sun-dried betel nuts into small pieces to sell in the local market shops and nearby pan stalls.

Sonabi is a hardworking entrepreneur who is always concerned with her family’s well being. She is seeking a loan from BJS, a Kiva partner, to purchase raw betel nuts in bulk. This will enable her to earn a profit to a large extent. 

Her dream is to enhance the business and obtain a greater income that will enable her to provide greater opportunity for her family to get ahead.

Sonabi is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw betel nuts in a bulk for her existing business.

loans.name: Sahida

texts.en:
Sahida is a 25-year-old married woman from Falakata. She is a mother of one son who is too small to go to school. Sahida has attended school up to grade 9. Sahida lives with her family in a small village of Falakata in Alipurduar district.

She is a dedicated homemaker, raising her child and taking care of her family. Her husband, Asadul, is engaged in agricultural activities. He cultivates potatoes, carrots, beans, and gourds on his farmland and he sells his products to the local markets. He chose this business because he has a good knowledge of agricultural activities. Sahida assists her husband in agricultural activities. 

Now with the growing needs of the family, her husband needs to increase his business. So he has decided to cultivate pointed gourd, the much demanded crop in his region.

Sahida has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase necessary farm supplies like pointed gourd seeds, chemical and organic fertilizers, etc. so, that they have a good harvest this year. Some of her biggest dreams are to buy more farm land for her husband to get more production. She would like to see her son gets proper education and grow into a professional in the future.

She is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs for pointed gourd cultivation.

loans.name: Chumki

texts.en:
Chumki is a 32-year-old lady who lives with her husband and their two sons. The boys are studying in different grades. They live in a small village in Alipurduar, West Bengal.  

Chumki and her husband jointly run a grocery shop where they sell essential commodities of everyday life like rice, oil, salt, sugar, flour, biscuits, eggs etc. This shop is the only source of income for the family and Chumki runs this shop with her husband after managing her household work.

Besides aspiring to provide their children good education, Chumki and her husband also hope to save enough to access better living conditions. To that end, they work very hard to save a little from their earnings. To generate more income and to cover all the costs of a four-member family smoothly, Chumki wants to expand her business by adding more items to her inventory for sale. To stock and store this inventory, she needs financial help. So she requests a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to invest in these purchases. 

With the expansion of her business, her income has been projected to increase substantially. She wants to use the additional income to admit their children to renowned schools. She will also have the option of reinvesting these savings in her business for further growth, and the savings can help them achieve their simple goals.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is 63 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, soap, noodles and school supplies.

Nimfa has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Nimfa aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, soap, noodles and school supplies

loans.name: Juthika

texts.en:
Juthika is a 39-year-old woman who is active and optimistic. She is a housewife who lives with her husband and only daughter in Alipurduar. Their young daughter is in grade 5.

To look after his family and bear the household expenses, Juthika’s husband is running a small stationery shop that sells various types of items like books, notebooks, pens, pencils, scales, erasers, pencil boxes, geometry boxes, etc. Juthika helps her husband and looks after the shop in his absence. But the store does not provide them much profit as they are unable to stock more varieties of items due to lack of capital.
  
As the business continues, she requested a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to enable her to purchase varieties of stationery items to fulfill her customers’ demands. This loan would help her in running her business smoothly and consequently support her for building more stationery shops in the future.

She dreams to admit her only daughter to a renowned school so that she becomes a professional.

She conveys her thanks to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of items for her husband’s stationery shop.

loans.name: Shibani

texts.en:
Shibani is an energetic and enterprising woman of 31 years. She is married and is blessed with one daughter. Her daughter reads in grade 9 in the local village school. She lives with her husband and daughter in Alipurduar in West Bengal, India. 

Shibani runs a paan stall with the assistance of her husband near to their house. Paan is a mouth freshener, combining betel leaf with betel nut and slaked lime; it is chewed for its stimulant and psychoactive effects, used especially in rural areas. She sells varieties of paans and also other mouth fresheners in her shop. She has many customers who are attracted of her preparation of paan in the locality.

Now Shibani and her husband want to extend their business. Their customers are increasing day by day. But she does not have sufficient capital to invest in her business. Thus, Shibani asked for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to buy more varieties of ingredients like betel leaves, betel nuts, lime, and other sweet masalas for her business. She hopes this loan will give a boost to her business. 

Her priority is to provide her daughter a good education so that she can be established in life and Shibani wants to save money from the profit of her business for her daughter.    

She is grateful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase necessary ingredients for her existing paan shop.

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Ra, 35, lives in a small community of Battambong Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of two children. She is a grocery seller and earns, on average, an earning of USD 5.00 a day. So far, she has been in this type of business for around ten years. 

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Lyziel

texts.en:
Lyziel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lyziel is 46 years old and both of her children are sent to school.

Lyziel has a personal product retail business in the Philippines. Lyziel requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase additional items like bags, body lotion, perfume and other personal products to sell.

Lyziel has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Lyziel would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like bags, body lotion, perfume and other personal products to sell.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela is 54 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Rosela is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosela has been farming vegetables for 2 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rotilla

texts.en:
Rotilla is 54 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Rotilla has a frozen food retail business in the Philippines. Rotilla requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more frozen foods to sell in her food stall.

Rotilla has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Rotilla would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Gine

texts.en:
Gine is 38 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, Gine works very hard to provide for them.

Gine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like snack foods, eggs, bread, biscuits, canned goods, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Gine has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, eggs, bread, biscuits, canned goods, detergent soap, etc. 

In the future, Gine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like snack foods, eggs, bread, biscuits, canned goods, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Amelia is 45 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Amelia has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Amelia requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials such as thread, yardage, and zippers and pay for maintenance for her sewing machine.

Amelia has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials such as thread, yardage, and zippers and pay for maintenance for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is 48 years old and has three children. Candelaria is married and has one child still in school.

Candelaria is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Candelaria requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Candelaria has been in this business for 15 years now  and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maribeth is 37 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Maribeth has a general store business in the Philippines. Maribeth requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Maribeth has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Maribeth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia works hard to support her family. Cynthia is married and has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines.

Cynthia requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of dry goods to sell.

Cynthia has been in this business for 15 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items of dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Archie

texts.en:
Archie is 41 years old and has three children. She is married and all of her children are sent to school.

Archie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Archie requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Archie has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Archie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Anghelita

texts.en:
Anghelita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Anghelita is 56 years old now.

Anghelita has a beverages vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more beverages to sell.

Anghelita has been in this business for 36 years. In the future, Anghelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more beverages to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 44 years old, married, and has five children. One child is currently in school.

Teresita is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Teresita has been in pig fattening for 3 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Teresita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Cherry Mae

texts.en:
Cherry Mae is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 24 years old now.

Cherry Mae has a food-processing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Cherry Mae has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 45 years old and married with seven children. With three children currently in school, Elma works very hard to provide for them.

Elma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like drinks, milk, coffee, juice, breads, canned goods, noodles, spices, etc.

Elma has been in this business for six years.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like drinks, milk, coffee, juice, breads, canned goods, noodles, spices, etc

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is a 50-year-old married woman with six children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Ellen has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her stall.

Ellen has been in this business for five years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her stall

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina is a 50-year-old married woman with six children, one attends school.

Agustina ihas grown vegetables for 15 years and requests 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She has previously borrowed 2 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Agustina would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Verónica Gisella

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Vista Al Mar se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía muy variada y muchos atractivos turísticos que atraen al turista nacional o extranjero.
En este lugar vive la señora Verónica, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 15 y 10 años los mismos estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Verónica es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos  se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, zapatillas y sabanas, ella sale a visitar a sus clientes uno o dos días a la semana aunque la mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza en su casa, tiene mucha clientela ya que les da crédito y cobra cada 8 o 15 días. Lleva más de 10 años con este negocio el cual le permite ganarse sus propios recursos.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatillas y sabanas ya que tiene muchos pedidos. Lleva más de 3 años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos financia su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos y su  familia.
texts.en:
The Vista Al Mar loan group meets every 15 days in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that are visited often throughout the year, for its very varied gastronomy and for many tourist attractions for Ecuadorians or foreigners. Verónica lives here; she is 38 years old, is married and has two children from this relationship, ages 15 and 10, who are in school and high school. Her husband is a merchant.

Verónica is a housewife, and to make her own money she works selling all kinds of clothing, shoes and sheets. She goes out to visit her customers one or two days a week, although she makes most of her sales at home. She has a lot of customers, since she gives them credit and charges every 8 or 15 days. She has had this business for more than 10 years, and it allows her to earn her own money. This loan is to buy clothing, shoes and sheets, as she has a lot of requests. 

She has been in the loan group for more than 3 years and she likes it because she is able to finance her business thanks to the loans. Her dream is to give her children and family the best she can.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes and sheets

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a  51-year- old widow with three children,  one child attends school.

Emma has raised pigs for 10 years and requests 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies.

She earns additional income from an auto repair shop, general store, and motorcycle transportation business.   She has previously borrowed 1 time from NWTF to sustain her businesses.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a 65-year-old married woman with three children who is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Estrella has had a bicycle transportation business for 8 years and requests 18,000 PHP  through NWTF to purchase a bicycle and other supplies.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and  requests another loan to further build her businesses.

 In the future, Estrella would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a bicycle and other supplies.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina works hard to support her family. Gina is married and has had a weaving business for 26 years.  She earns additional income from water refilling station.

Gina requests 10, 000 PHP through NWTF to buy materials for her weaving business.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a 63-year-old woman with one child who works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store for 2 years and requests 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Lilia has previously borrowed 3 times from NWTF. She earns additional income raising pigs.

Lilia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.d

loans.name: Ivy Ann

texts.en:
Ivy Ann is a 33-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Ivy Ann has a bakery shop business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her business like flour, cooking oil, sugar, etc.

Ivy Ann has been in this business for one year. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her business like flour, cooking oil, sugar, etc

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
"Darkside Fitness", expected to open in the fall of 2015, will be a holistic fitness studio in Oceanside, CA, that offers innovative fitness classes such as pole fitness, yoga, aerial arts, calisthenics, partner yoga, and personal training. Andrea is the owner of Darkside Fitness and her passion in life has always been helping others. She discovered dancing as a child and competed and performed in a variety of dance types such as ballet, tap, jazz, and pointe. As an adult, she began seeking a form of dance she could get back into as she had enjoyed it so much as a child. Although she has never worked as an exotic dancer, she appreciates pole as a sensual form of art and enjoys empowering women and men through fitness and dance. 

Andrea began performing in 2012, teaching pole and yoga in 2013, and competing in 2014. She enjoyed teaching at a local studio, but saw an opportunity to open her own studio and reach more men and women, make classes more affordable, and provide a variety of classes that would decrease risk for injury and improve overall well-being. As an occupational therapist of 9 years and a personal trainer, Andrea believes in a holistic approach to fitness and incorporates a combination of strength, flexibility, and cardiovascular training into her fitness classes.

Starting this business has been challenging for Andrea for a number of reasons. Although she has had a great career for 9 years and has been working very hard, she has run into quite a bit of bad luck financially. Just a few of the things that she has had to overcome over the past few years include owning a house in Atlanta that had the roof destroyed by a hurricane, having the house later vandalized with over $30,000 worth of damage, having renters in the house that caused over $5,000 worth of damage, and most recently, a ruptured appendix that cost her over $13,000.

The money from this loan will be used for fitness equipment such as fitness poles, aerial silks, aerial hoops, calisthenics equipment, yoga equipment, and safety equipment. Without this loan, there is no way Andrea would be able to afford this equipment which will help many people achieve their personal fitness goals – thanks to Kiva for helping her make that happen.

loans.use: to pay for startup costs, including safety equipment and inventory, for her holistic fitness studio

loans.name: Jenny Julieta

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Jenny, ella pertenece al banco “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. 
La socia sigue dedicándose a su negocio de venta de comida, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia la socia continua elaborando diferentes tipos de platos apara sus  clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz,menestras entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas
texts.en: Jenny belong to the “Señor de los Temblores II” communal bank of the city of Cusco, Perú. She continues with her business selling food. She has had the business for some time and things are going well for her thanks to the determination she brings to her work each day. She continues to make different types of foods for her clients who request them. She wants to be able to continue to work and in this way continue to support her family. She is requesting the loan to buy rice, and vegetables amongst others. She is grateful for the loan awarded and promises to comply with the established installments.

loans.use: to buy rice and vegetables amongst others.

loans.name: Glecylen

texts.en:
Glecylen is a married woman with 3 children who works hard to support her family.

She has a flower business and earns additional income from fish vending. Glecylen is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional flowers to sell.

Glecylen has sustained her business  through 1 previous loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional flowers.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is a 54-year-old married woman with two children. She works hard to provide for her family and has run a general store for 5 years.  She requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase eggs, canned goods, bread, and noodles.

Glenda has borrowed and repaid 7 previous loans from NWTF.  She earns additional income from vegetable vending.

Glenda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase eggs, canned goods, bread, and noodles.

loans.name: Jenith

texts.en:
Jenith is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jenith is 41 years old, and all of her children are still in school.

Jenith has a dried coconut meat business in the Philippines. Jenith requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more coconut to make dried coconut meat.

Jenith has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut to make dried coconut meat

loans.name: Van's Group

texts.en:
Van, born in 1971, is the Kinh ethnic majority woman. She joined the program of M7-MFI in October 2014. Her family consists of four members, her husband, two sons and herself. They  live in the city of Son La, the city under the Son La province. 

Her family runs a small business and the income is just enough to cover the family’s living expense and save a small amount. She intends to invest in breeding honeybees but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to borrow money for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time and hopes that the loan will help her family to invest effectively in breeding honeybees. Next year, this breeding model will bring her family tons of honey with a considerable profit.

loans.use: to invest in breeding honeybees.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a 47-year-old married woman with eleven children, sic attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Nilda has had a  copra business for 1 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more sacks of copra to sell.

In the future, Nilda would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of copra.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Zenaida is 53 years old now.

Zenaida has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and she requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

Zenaida has been in this business for one year. In the future, Zenaida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jenalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a pottery-making business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a general store. Jenalyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her pottery-making business.

Jenalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business

loans.name: Toni

texts.en:
The Elite Dance Center was Toni’s lifelong goal. Since she was five years old, she wanted nothing more than to not only be a dancer but to own a dance school. Growing up, dancing was the one thing in life she looked forward to in her week. She came from a not so great home; they had very little money. Toni decided very young that she would put in whatever work was needed to achieve her dream. 

Elite is now approaching its third year and it still sometimes feels like a dream. Toni calls it the “miracle dance studio” because without some work of God, it would have never happened. Dreams are being lived and built here. Toni’s students are her most precious part of Elite. There is nothing better than helping and watching them achieve everything they want as well.

Like any business the financial part can often hold a strain. Toni started this business with nothing of her own, but with the help of organizations like VEDC she has been able to push through. Each year things look up and this loan will help her make it through those dreaded summer months of almost no income. Toni appreciates all that Kiva does. What happens at Elite every day is amazing, and Toni herself, her staff, and her students thank you.

loans.use: to open another dance studio; she needs money for tenant improvement

loans.name: Bernadita

texts.en:
Bernadita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a kitchen wares business for 12 years. She earns additional income selling clothes.

She is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock of kitchen wares.

Bernadita has sustained her business  through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She wants to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen wares to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en:
Lidia Tax Service was established by Lidia as a sole proprietorship. She began tax preparation in 1995 in an income tax office. After a few years working in an income tax office, she decided to take the plunge and run an small tax preparation business out of her home. She began using a computer borrowed from a friend and her first clients were only friends and friends of friends. Today, however, almost 20 years later, she boasts of multiplying her client pool because of her dedication.

Lidia is a strong advocate for financial literacy, especially in the Hispanic community where it is so low. Her clientele is predominantly Hispanic, non-English speakers who cannot use a computer. She has established herself in that community as a trustworthy, reliable source for financial services. She recently added immigration consultation services, bookkeeping, accounting, and other financial services. 

With this loan, Ms. Lidia will be able to cover the expenses to move to a larger location that is also more accessible to her clients.

loans.use: to pay for moving expenses to a new, larger  location, more accessible both for herself  and her clients

loans.name: Las Inseparables Group

texts.es:
Sofia es una mujer de 54 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos de 12, 14 y 16 años de edad, y su negocio es la venta de pipocas y helado.
Ella es buena madre, optimista, atenta, constante, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘plan 3000’ caracterizada por ser el área de mayor crecimiento de la ciudad, sus pobladores en la mayoría son residentes de otras ciudades. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Sofia es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, viste de forma tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (de pie, la primera de la derecha, viste blusa rosa y mandil celeste). Su vida la comparte con su esposo  que trabaja como constructor y  con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de pipocas y helados; también conocidas como palomitas de maíz, son elaborados a partir del maíz. La preparación consiste en calentar una olla o sartén para esparcir el maíz, hasta que explote, “vendo a la hora del recreo y salida en los colegios cercanos, ya llevo varios años en el rubro…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos, la desventaja es la época de vacaciones escolares donde las ventas bajan. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de granos y semillas, ella desea realizar la compra de un carrito pipoquero y heladero para cambiar el que tiene que ya está desgastado. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Sofia solicita un préstamo para la compra de un carrito pipoquero y heladero para reemplazar el que tiene y con los beneficios abrir una tienda de granos.
texts.en:
54-year-old Sofia is married and has three children aged 12, 14 and 16. She has a business selling popcorn and ice cream. She is a good mother and is optimistic, attentive, dependable, likeable, responsible and very hard working. She runs her business in the 'plan 3000' area which is the area of greatest growth in the city. The people who live there are mainly from other cities. It has a warm sub-tropical climate with a temperature which varies between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade during the day. 

Sofia is dark-skinned with brown eyes and long black hair which she wears in a plait. She is short and slim and wears traditional dress (hat, shawl and full skirt). Her mother tongue is Guaraní which she speaks within the family and for general and work purposes she speaks Spanish. In the photo she is standing first on the right, wearing a pink blouse and blue apron. She shares her life with her husband who works as a builder and her children who are at school. They live in their own accommodation built from bricks and cement with a corrugated metal roof and earth floor which has running water, electricity and sewerage. 

Her business is selling 'pipocas' or popcorn, which is made from corn. The preparation involves heating a saucepan or frying pan of corn until it explodes. Sofia says 'I sell during breaks and at the end of the school day at nearby schools and have been doing this for several years'. The benefit of her business is that she has a continuous supply of customers but the disadvantage is that her sales go down during the school holidays. Her dream is to open a shop selling grains and seeds. She wants to buy a cart for selling popcorn and ice cream to replace the one she has which is worn out. This is her second loan cycle with the institution in the 10 years she has been running this business. 

For these reasons Sofia is asking for a loan to buy a popcorn/ice cream cart to replace the one she has and to open a shop selling grains with the profits she makes.

loans.use: to buy a cart for selling popcorn and ice cream to replace the one she has and with the profits open a shop selling grain.

loans.name: Lulibeth

texts.en:
Lulibeth is 40 years old and married with one child. Lulibeth works very hard to provide for them.

Lulibeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, cigarettes, home care products and other groceries.

Lulibeth has been in this business for 12 years now. 

In the future, Lulibeth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products,  cigarettes, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from pig fattening.  

Aileen is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy more seafoods to sell for her fish vending business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafoods to sell.

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is 34 years old and married and she has four children, all of whom are presently in school.

Jona is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Jona requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig. She has been in this business for 8 years now, and she has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for tenant improvements (an outdoor patio) for her cafe.

loans.name: Ma. Ana

texts.en:
Ma. Ana is 38 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Ma. Ana is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Ma. Ana has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Ana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Marisol, ella pertenece al banco “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. 
La socia Marisol sigue dedicándose a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia la socia continua elaborando diferentes tipos de platos apara sus  clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz,menestras entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Señora Marisol belongs to the “Señor de los Temblores II” communal bank in Cusco, Perú. 
Marisol is still making her living selling food as a street vendor.  She has had her business for quite some time, and it is going well for her because of the hard work she puts into it each day.  She prepares the different types of dishes that her customers request.  Marisol hopes to continue working so she can keep supporting her family. 
Marisol is requesting the loan to purchase rice, vegetable stews and other items. 
She feels grateful for the loan she has been granted and promises to comply with her established repayment plan.

loans.use: to purchase rice, vegetable stews and other items.

loans.name: Monserrate Guadalupe

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la provincia de Manabí  se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Horizontes De 24 de Mayo, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 
En este lugar vive la señora Monserrate, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos de 23, 19, 17 y 13 años, los dos menores estudian en colegio. Su esposo es panadero.
Doña Monserrate junto a su esposo se han dedicado por más de 21 años a la fabricación de pan, negocio con el cual han sacado adelante a su familia y que hoy en día es fuente de ingresos tanto para ellos y para sus hijos. Empezaron con muy poco pero a medida que paso el tiempo fueron aumentando la producción y la venta de otros productos complementarios, además de pan allí también vende azúcar, leche, café y muchos otros productos que les dejan muy buenos ingresos. Ella siempre pide la ayuda de los créditos ya que desde que los recibe su vida ha mejorado y por eso está muy agradecida con la fundación y con las personas que le ayudan con los créditos.
Este crédito es para comprar harina, huevos, leche, azúcar, café, sodas y muchas otras cosas que vende en su local. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque con los créditos cada vez mejora más su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
In the 24 De Mayo canton of the province of Manabí the "Nuevos Horizontes De 24 de Mayo" communal bank meets. This place is known for it's beautiful landscapes and for it's hard-working people who work in agriculture and raising animals.

Monserrate lives here. She is 39 years old, married and from this relationship has 4 children aged 23, 19, 17 and 13 years old. The youngest two study in secondary school. Her husband is a baker.

Monserrate for the past 21 years along with her husband has worked making bread, a business with which she has raised her family and today is the source of income not only for them but for her children. They started off with little but with the passing of time little by little they increased their production and selling other complimentary products. Besides bread she also sells sugar, milk, coffee, and many other products that produce very good income.

She has always requested the support of loans as since she has received them her life has improved. So she is very grateful to the institution and to the people who support the loans. She will use the loan to buy flour, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, soft drinks and many other things that sell in their store. She has been in communal bank since it's inception as she improves her business with each loan. Her dream is to give her family the best.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 40 years old and married and she has four children, three of whom are in school.

Elma is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Elma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been in this business for 12 years now, and she has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Farima's Group

texts.fr: Farima qui se trouve sur la photo assise avec le drapeau de myAgro, est membre d’un groupe de 4 agricultrices inscrites  à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Djoliba au sud-ouest de Bamako au Mali. Farima, âgée de 63 ans, fait partie d’une famille composée  de 35 personnes, dont 17 d’entre elles sont actuellement scolarisées.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosuffisance pour sa famille, ont incité Farima à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 50 ans. Farima cultive l'arachide, le riz sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Farima entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité, ainsi que des engrais de qualité. Cette année Farima effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 42 ans que Farima cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Enfin Farima espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille et financer le mariage de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Farima, who is sitting holding the banner of myAgro, is a member of a group of four farmers registered with myAgro, living and working in the village of  Djoliba in the southwest of Bamako, Mali. Farima, aged 63, is part of a family made up of 35 people, of whom 17 are presently in school. 

The anchor of the family tradition in agriculture, the principal source of income and food self-sufficiency for her household, moved Farima to work in this field for 50 years now. Farima grows peanuts and rice on her plot, but as a farmer she has to face difficulties such as lack of rain, of agricultural supplies, and of high-quality fertilizer.  Farima is beginning her first year with myAgro and she registered because of the payment system and the high-quality seeds. This year, Farima is making payments to purchase a myAgro package of OPV (openly pollinated variety) seeds and fertilizer to grow peanuts, so as to increase her yield on her plot of 0.0625 hectare. 

Farima has been growing peanuts for 42 years now for their value as a foodstuff, explaining that peanuts are directly edible by the family and are used as a base for sauces in cooking. They are also valuable commercially, since peanuts are a foodstuff that Farima sells at the market. Finally, Farima also hopes to cover school fees for the children, ensure food self-sufficiency for the family, and pay for the weddings of her children.

loans.use: to buy herself a package of OPV seeds and fertilizer for growing peanuts.

loans.name: Jonabelle

texts.en:
Jonabelle is 46 years old and married with three children. With two children still in school, Jonabelle works very hard to provide for them.

For 10 years, Jonabelle has operated a general store in the Philippines.  She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell like canned goods, shampoo, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil and other personal care products.

She would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell like canned goods, shampoo, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, and other personal care products

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 40 years old and has three children.  She is married and has three children who attend school.

For 5 years Erlinda has operated an agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines.  She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.  She has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Mercedes, ella pertenece al banco “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
 La socia continua dedicándose a la venta de comida en su restaurante, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua elaborando diferentes tipos de comidas para sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de menestras,arroz entre otros.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por otorgarle el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Señora Mercedes belongs to the “Señor de los Temblores II” communal bank in Cusco, Perú.
Mercedes is still earning her living selling food in her restaurant.  She is a very responsible and hard-working person.  She makes different types of food for the customers who order from her, and that is how she is getting her family ahead.
Mercedes is requesting the loan to purchase vegetable stews, rice and other items.
She is very grateful to KIVA for granting her the loan, and she promises to comply with her established repayment plan.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable stews, rice and other items.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Norma, ella pertenece al banco “Señor de los Temblores II” ,el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Norma  sigue con su negocio de imprenta, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de papeles,cartuchos  entre otros.
texts.en:
Señora Norma belongs to the “Señor de los Temblores II” communal bank, which is located in Cusco District, Cusco Province and Cusco Department.
Norma still has her printing business.  She has had business for quite some time, and it is going well for her thanks to the hard work she puts into it each day.  Norma is a responsible and hard-working person who wants to continue working so she can keep supporting her family. 
Norma is requesting the loan to purchase paper, cartridges and other items.

loans.use: to purchase paper, cartridges and other items.

loans.name: Baby Girl

texts.en:
Baby Girl is 21 years old and single. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Baby Girl has a fish-selling business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

In the future, Baby Girl would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 64 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Elizabeth has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years. Elizabeth requested a 20,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Serafina

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora  Serafina, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. 
La socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de planchado y pintura para vehículos motorizados, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua trabajando en su negocio para de esta manera poder continuar apoyando a su familia.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pinturas.
texts.en:
The member is Serafina, she is a part of the communal bank “Señor de los Temblores II" in the city of Cusco, Perú. 
She continues to work in her auto body repair and paint business. She is a responsible and diligent person. She continues to work in her business because in this way she can continue to support her family.  
She is grateful for the loan she was given and she promises to make all the required payments. She is requesting the loan in order to buy paint.

loans.use: to buy paint.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
El socio es el señor  Sergio, él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. 
El socio Sergio continua dedicándose a brindar el  servicio de taxi, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso,el socio continua trabajando para de esta forma continuar apoyando a su familia, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando en su negocio.
El socio solicito el crédito para realizar el cambio de aceite de su carro.
Sergio agradece a  KIVA por permitirle desarrollarse y mantenerse en su actividad económica.
texts.en:
This is Sergio, who is a member of the communal bank “Señor de Los Temblores II” in the city of Cusco, Peru. He continues with his business of providing taxi services and is a responsible and determined person. He continues working in order to continue supporting his family, and wants to be able to keep working in his business. 

He is requesting a loan in order to change the oil in his car. Sergio is grateful to Kiva for allowing him to develop and maintain his business activity.

loans.use: para realizar el cambio de aceite de su carro.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 34 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family.
