Rosemarie earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy vitamins and feed for her business.

Rosemarie has been in pig fattening for four years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and feed for her business.

loans.name: Mayshelle

texts.en:
Mayshelle is 29 years old, married and has one child.

Mayshelle is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Mayshelle requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Mayshelle has been in this business for 4 years now, she also earns additional income from general store and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani is 34 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are in school.

Lani is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Lani requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her livestock.

Lani has been raising livestock for four years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lani would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Melane

texts.en:
Melane is 40 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Melane works very hard to provide for them.

Melane runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy assorted items to sell .

Melane has been in this business for 12 years. 

In the future, Melane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted items to sell to save to send her kids to college

loans.name: Mabelle

texts.en: Mabelle is a businesswoman who earns through retailing various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurances and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She is on her way to repairing her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks to be able to live comfortably

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is engaged in running a grocery store. She has been operating her business for 8 years and earns a monthly net income of 3,500 PHP. Nancy is 51 years old, married and has four children. She is from Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. In 2009, Nancy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and develop her skill in business engagements. 

She has successfully repaid a previous loans from PMPC. The previous loan was used for personal purposes. Now, Nancy is requesting her 6th loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used for the expansion of her existing business. She wants to buy more inventories for her store to sell.

loans.use: She wants to buy more inventory for her store to sell, to expand her store

loans.name: Warlito

texts.en: Warlito is a widower who lives in Cartagena Proper, Plaridel, Mis. Occ. For a living, he is engaged in dried fish vending starting up with a capital of 3,000 PHP. He has a good return doing this type of business, enabling him to support his needs. Warlito is planning to expand his resources, so he applied for a loan from Paglaum MP Cooperative, of which he became a member in 2009 to pay for more inventory of dried fish for retail. He wants to have a stall in the public market to display his dried fish. Someday he hopes to live a happy and healthy life with adequate income from his business.

loans.use: to pay for more inventory of dried fish for retail

location.town: Plaridel - Cartagena Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Liwayway

texts.en:
Liwayway, is aged 32, married to a sales clerk and they're blessed with two children. She owns and manages a retail store in their village for almost 10 years and earns a net income of PHP 500 daily.

Due to insufficient capital on her business she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase coffee, cooking oil, sugar, canned goods, beverages, food ingredients and bread to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase coffee, cooking oil, sugar, canned goods, beverages, food ingredients and bread to sell.

loans.name: Rene

texts.en: Rene, a responsible father, is requesting a loan from Paglaum MPC, which he will use to increase his inventory. He wants to buy more assorted goods for his store. He wants to buy bar soap, canned goods, sugar and biscuits for retail. This way, he will be able to sell more products, which will allow him to earn more money and provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more assorted goods for his store

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 21 years old, with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Jean runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, condiments, and other groceries.

Mary Jean has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Mary Jean would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, condiments, and other groceries

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Minerva is 42 years old and has one child in school.

Minerva has a mat weaving business in the Philippines. Minerva requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business.

Minerva has been in this business for 24 years. In the future, Minerva would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her mat weaving business

loans.name: Norberta

texts.en:
Norberta engages in the hog raising business. She raises and sells pigs to earn a living. She resides in Panglao, Bohol. She is a 58-year-old married woman with eight children. Three of her children are still attending school, aged 10 to 20 years old. Her husband earns a living by being a laborer. She needs funds to continue financing her existing livelihood.

She is asking for a loan to buy three piglets, pig feed and vitamins. These will enable Norberta to improve her livelihood. With these, she will be able to raise and sell quality hogs. Thus, her earnings will become stable and she will be able to pay her obligations. Norberta will be able to provide her children with nutritious diets and better living conditions.

In the future, she dreams of improving her hog raising business to become sustainable.

loans.use: to buy three piglets, pig feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Qaytiniso

texts.en:
Qaytiniso is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1967. She is living in a small town. She is married and has four children. She is busy with agriculture and knows her business very well. Her husband is a woodworker. She controls and owns her business by herself. This season was too dry and she could not have a good harvest. Her husband’s work is not permanent and he works only with orders. 

She was upset and decided to appeal to IMON asking for a help. She needs money for family expenditures, as food and clothing. She hopes in this hard time in her life, Kiva and IMON will support her.

loans.use: to pay for family expenditures, such as food and clothing

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita has mastered her swine production in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. This is how she makes a living, supporting her husband in raising their family. She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to avail herself of credit to fully support her business. Just as she takes care of her swine production business, so it is with her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so that she can always apply for any financing she may need. This loan of PHP 5,000 will be used to purchase bags of gestating feed for her swine. Anita hopes and prays that her business will grow because that will help her save enough for future emergencies. She wishes to live a happy and healthy life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of gestating feed for her swine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase stock to establish a new business running a small store

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ruth is 27 years old now.

Ruth has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ruth requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Ruth has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Ruth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell, to provide a secure living for her family

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Josephine is 42 years old and all of her children are in school.

Josephine has a buy and sell recycled materials in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more recycled materials to resell.

Josephine has been in this business for six years. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials to resell.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios is a widow with five children who are all in their adult age. Her major source of income is rice farming, and she is also engaged in palay (pre-husked rice) trading and sells rice. She has been in this business for 21 years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially for the education of her children until they graduated and got jobs. She is still continuing the business because it provides a good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Remedios wants to expand her rice production so that her customers will be served well and she will be able to supply more sacks in the market. She is planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She already availed herself of loans previously to purchase more sacks of palay to produce more rice and now she is re-applying for a loan for her rice production business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of palay (pre-husked rice) to produce more rice.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 36 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, and other groceries.

Elizabeth has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, snack foods, condiments, etc. 

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, and other groceries

loans.name: Nenia

texts.en:
Nenia works hard to support her family. Nenia is married with one child and has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

Nenia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items more items of ready-to-wear: clothes, pants, T-shirts, slippers, and bags, shoes and other products to sell.

Nenia has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items of ready-to-wear: clothes, pants, T-shirts, slippers, and also bags, shoes and other products to sell

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
La señora Anastacia tiene 51 años, está casada, tiene tres hijos ya todos mayores de edad, que ella pudo sacar adelante por medio de su trabajo y su lucha.
Es artesana, se inició en el rubro hace más de 30  años, cuenta con clientela formada gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos. Está saliendo adelante por medio de su trabajo y lucha.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar hilos y telas, de manera a poder hacer sus artesanías como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Anastacia, 51, is married. She has 3 children who are all adults and she provided for them by means of her job and her hard work.

Anastacia is an artisan. She started in this business more than 30 years ago. She has an established clientele due to the quality of her products. She is getting ahead by means of her job and her hard work. Anastacia is requesting this loan to buy thread and fabric so she can continue making her crafts just as she has been.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric, and other items to make crafts.

loans.name: Enelyn

texts.en: Enelyn is from Dumalinao. She is 28 years old and has 2 children. She strives hard for the family in doing her farming activities. She and her husband helped each other for their piece of land planted with rice and corn. In the future, Enelyn hopes to purchase another parcel of land for them to cultivate as added income.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizers

loans.name: Hilda Isabel

texts.es:
Hilda Isabel tiene 32 años de edad, vive junto con su esposo e hijos en su propia casa en el Distrito de Zaña, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno y animales menores como gallinas, patos y pavos, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y sus clientes brindan buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de animales menores y alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos, esto le permitirá incrementar su negocio y por ende su nivel de ingresos lo que mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Hilda Isabel is 32 years old, she lives together with her partner and their children in their own home located in the District of Zaña, a community known for its agriculture, trade and livestock breeding. It is located in Chiclayo Province which belongs to the Lambayeque Region, on the northern coast of Peru. 

She earns a living raising cattle and young animals such as chickens, ducks and turkeys. Her business is located behind her home, and she has experience in her business with many customers who provide good personal and work references of her. She has asked for a loan to purchase young animals and balanced feeds to fatten the animals, this will allow her to grow her business and thus her income which will improve the quality of life of her and her family.

loans.use: to purchase small animals and also feed to fatten them

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 38 years old and married with two children. With both children in school, Helen works very hard to provide for them.

Helen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries.

Helen has been in this business for some years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, snack foods, candies, condiments, and other groceries. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn works hard to support her family. Rodelyn is married and has a raising pigs business in the Philippines.

Rodelyn requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rodelyn has been in this business for 15 years now, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria tiene 59 años, es de la ciudad de Itá, ella tiene una olería en un propio terreno en el cual trabaja y tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia. Ella además tiene una plantación de verdeos a la vez que trabaja en su olería. Ella esta poniendo todo de si para poder mejorar cada día y salir adelante.
Ella pide este préstamo para la compra de arcilla para poder seguir con su trabajo en la olería como lo viene haciendo, y así seguir proveyendo de ladrillos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria is 59 years old and is from the city of Itá. She has a brick-making operation in a piece of land she owns and in which she works, and has the means to help her family. In addition to her brick-making operation, she also has a green onion plantation. She is giving her all so that she can improve every day and get ahead.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of clay so that she can continue with her work in the brick-making operation as she has been doing so far, and, by doing so, continue to provide bricks for her clients.

loans.use: To buy clay so that she can make bricks to sell.

loans.name: Visa

texts.en:
Visa is 52 years old, she is married with 6 children and lives in Katipa, Lopez Jaena. Visa and her husband earning a living through farming. They mastered doing this type of activity as they get married, supported her children's education and their family needs. She joined Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative on July of 2011. She is a hardworking mother who has strong determination to pursue her goals for the benefit of her family, alleviating poverty. 

Visa requested a loan to purchase fertilizer to have high crop yield on her corn and vegetable farm. This will help her farming income a big boost. Someday, she hopes to buy land to expand her farming activities and venture into agri-business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to have high crop yield on her corn and vegetable farm

loans.name: Marife

texts.en: Marife has a palay trading business and is supervising the renovation of their home. Marife hopes to live comfortably with a house of good roofing supported by her loan of Php 15,000. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with good repayment record. This is what she is thankful for when all her financing needs on her retailing business where supported by PMPC.

loans.use: for house renovation, with a good roof

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en: Jorge lives in Ozamiz  and renovates building houses from the ground up. He has applied another loan, which he used to buy building material, paints, and to pay his workers. He wants his daughters to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work he has had to endure.

loans.use: to buy building material, paints & pay his workers

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is 38 years old, married, with four beautiful children. She has been a dried fish vendor in their barangay for almost ten years. From this experience of selling, she already has great knowledge in dealing with this kind of business. Over the years, she has been successful and she manages to save more money for her family. 

Now, Belen is planning to pawn a parcel of coco land in order to manage a new business for additional income in the near future, which is creating a small pigpen. To fund this project, she needs additional capital to purchase more variety of dried fish for wholesale and retail, so she has requested a loan from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC).

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of dried fish for wholesale and retail

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a businesswoman who earns through food vending. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurances and financial assistance. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She is on her way to renovating her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks to renovate her house

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is driven by passion for selling. At the age of 55 and married in Plaridel, she runs a store to provide for the basic necessities of their family. Everyday she patiently tends her store until evening. 

Erlinda  wants to expand her business. She recently signed up her membership in Paglaum MPC to access insurances and financial assistance. Now, she has borrowed a loan of PHP 8,000 to pay for an inventory of assorted goods to sell. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her needs and those of the whole family.

loans.use: to pay for an inventory of assorted goods to sell, so as to provide for her family's needs

loans.name: Vicenta Genis

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus hermosas playas, por su rica y variada gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Grupo  De Crédito Solidario.
En este lugar vive la señora Vicenta, tiene 49 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene 3  hijos mayores de edad que viven con ellos. Su esposo trabaja eventualmente.
Doña Vicenta es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos para salir adelante ya que su marido en ocasiones no trabaja se dedica a la venta de productos Belcorp (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja casi todos los  días y sus ventas las realiza en las tardes o noches. También de lunes a viernes entrega almuerzos a domicilio y a personas que le piden en sus lugares de trabajo, su marido le ayuda en las entregas de los almuerzos, lleva más de 2 años con esta activada y con la venta de los productos mucho mas. 
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Esta desde el inicio en el grupo de crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son muy importantes para ella.  Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
In the city of Bahía de Caraquez, known for its beautiful beaches, for its delicious and varied cuisine, and for the quality of its people, every fifteen days the members of the Grupo de Crédito Solidario (Solidarity Credit Group) meet. Here lives Vicenta, who is 49 years old, maintains a common-law relationship and from this relationships has 3 adult children who live with them. Her husband works occasionally. 

Doña Vicenta is a housewife who, in order to earn her own resources to get ahead now that her husband sometimes does not work, devotes herself to the sale of Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women). She works almost every day and makes her sales in the afternoons or evenings. Additionally, from Monday to Friday she delivers lunches to homes and to people who order lunch from their offices. Her husband helps her deliver the lunches. She has worked for 2 years in delivering food and many more selling the beauty products. 

This loan in to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and supplies for food preparation. She has been in the credit group since the beginning, and likes it because the loans are very important for her. Her dreams are to have a big restaurant.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and supplies.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 58 years old and married.

Letecia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Letecia requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Letecia has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Letecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary Jane is 26 years old now.

Mary Jane has a buy and sell personal product care business in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted product to sell like lotions, shampoos, etc..

Mary Jane has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy assorted products to sell like lotions, shampoos, etc.

loans.name: Fabio

texts.es:
El señor Fabio tiene 30 años de edad, está casado, se dedica al servicio de mototaxi en una parada que está ubicada en un lugar estratégico de la ciudad y por medio de su trabajo ayuda a su familia y les da l que necesitan para una vida digna.
Fabio es una persona muy trabajadora que quiere crecer por medio de su esfuerzo es por ello que lucha y trabaja duro. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de una motocicleta nueva para poder ubicarla en otra parada y de esa forma poder expandirse y poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Fabio, 30, is married. He makes a living providing motorcycle taxi services at a stop that is located in a strategic place in the city. Through his work, he helps his family and gives them what they need for a decent life.

Fabio is a very hardworking individual who wants to grow by means of his efforts. This is why he is striving to work hard. Fabio is requesting a loan to buy a new motorcycle to place at another stop and thus continue to expand and grow.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to provide motorcycle taxi services.

loans.name: Rosene

texts.en:
Rosene is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosene is 47 years old, and three of her children are presently in school.

Rosene has a pottery-making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase materials for her business.

Rosene has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 45 years old and has five children. She is married, and three of her children are in school.

Teresita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Teresita has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel is 31 years old and has one child.

Anabel is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs and other supplies to raise livestock.

Anabel has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Anabel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs and other supplies to raise livestock.

loans.name: Rodelo

texts.en:
Rodelo, 36, is a married man with three children, ages 1, 4, and 14 years old respectively. Together with his family, he lives in Baclayon, Bohol. He engages in selling home-cooked meals like pansit (noodles), sauteed vegetables, fried fish, and other native menus. He has been engaged in this kind of business for more than five years.

He has requested a loan in the amount of 8,000 PHP to buy additional ingredients such as meat, spices, and vegetables. With these, Rodelo will be able to prepare a variety of home-cooked meals, and he could sell them to the locals in his place.

Thus, his earnings will improve and he will be able to handle his finances. He would be able to provide his family with good food and better shelter to live.

With the additional capital, Rodelo would be grateful to handle his business properly to be able to support the needs of his growing children for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients such as meat, spices, and vegetables.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 33 years old, married and has 4 children. To earn a living, she and her husband has cultivated their piece of agricultural land in Dumalinao planting bananas and other fruit bearing trees. Their farming activities has supported the education of their children. 
Mercedes has approached Paglaum MPC for her needed capitalization. FOr this cropping season, she loaned to pay for labor in land preparation .
In the future, Mercedes hopes to plant more crops for additional income.

loans.use: to pay for labor in land preparation to plant bananas and other fruits

loans.name: Willy

texts.es:
Willy tiene 26 años, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyuge y su hijo de 6 años de edad en el distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 4 años y buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus clientes. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha, esto lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto lo que le generará ingresos mayores que van a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Willy, age 26, lives with his wife and their six year old son in his own house made from basic materials.  He lives in the Pomahuaca district in a community that works in agriculture and with livestock.  It is located in the Jaén province in the Cajamaraca region in the northern highlands of Peru.

He devotes himself to agriculture.  Specifically, he grows coffee.  He has four years of experience in the field, and he has good personal and work references from his customers.

He will use the loan that he will be granted for agricultural work, applying plant products and fertilizer, as well as labor costs for his crop.  This will help him improve his coffee crop physiologically, morphologically, and productively. He will also have a timely crop and, therefore, a better yield and a better quality product. This way, he will have no problem selling his product, which will generate more income to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural work, products, fertilizers, and labor for his crop.

loans.name: Urbano

texts.es:
Urbano tiene 60 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en la parte rural del distrito de San Felipe, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y crianza de animales que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercio de ganado vacuno, cuenta con 8 años dedicándose al rubro y sus clientes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de una mayor cantidad de ganado para su negocio, con esto el espera incrementar el stock de su negocio lo que le va a generar ingresos mayores que mejorarán su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Urbano, age 60, lives with his wife and their two children in the rural part of the San Felipe district.  The community works in agriculture and raising animals.  It is located in the Jaén province in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.

He raises and sells cattle.  He has been in this line of work for eight years, and he customers provide him with very good personal and work references.

He will use the loan to buy more cattle for his business.  With this he plans to increase the stock in his business.  This will generate more income for him, which will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for his business.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Melanie works hard to support her family.

She has a pottery making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Melanie is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her pottery making business.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her pottery making business

loans.name: Mezzana Aiza

texts.en:
Mezzana Aiza works hard to support her family. Mezzana Aiza is single with one child and has a buy and sell personal items business in the Philippines.

Mezzana Aiza requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to to purchase assorted products such as perfumes, sandals, body lotions and etc.

Mezzana Aiza has been in this business for 3 years now, and also earns additional income from general store.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase assorted personal products such as perfumes, sandals, body lotions and etc

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Virginia is 49 years old and has one child in school.

Virginia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Virginia has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Virginia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell, to provide a secure future for her family

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Minda works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Minda is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to  buy ingredients such as meat, fish, chicken, flour, spices, cooking oil and other utensils for her food production business.

Minda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, fish, chicken, flour, spices, cooking oil and other utensils for her food production business

loans.name: Ceniza

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ceniza works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Ceniza is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business for her food vending business.

Ceniza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business, to ensure the future of her family

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Margie is 42 years old and has three children who are in school.

Margie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Margie requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more sea foods to sell.

Margie has been in this business for five years. In the future, Margie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell, to expand her business and continue sending her children to school

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a single parent of two children, Susan works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell bananas business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transportation. Susan is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more banana fruits to sell in her food stall for her banana business.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more banana fruits to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn has made a conscious effort in preparing for this cropping season. She has prepared for the enrollment of her three children.

Jovelyn and her husband cultivate their piece of land in Dumalinao for a living. She has accessed a loan to buy seedlings of corn and vegetables.

Jovelyn hopes to see all her children finish their studies and have stable careers.

loans.use: to buy seedlings for corn and vegetables.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
La Sra. Mariana está casada con el Sr. Juan y ambos tienen un hijo, ella es comerciante y tiene un negocio en cual vende productos variados de consumo diario, su esposo también trabaja y se ayudan mutuamente.
Mariana es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere salir adelante y está luchando para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder seguir con sus ventas, como ser verduras, frutas, enlatados y otros.
texts.en:
Mariana is married to Juan and they both have a child. She is a saleswoman and has a business where she sells various products for daily consumption. Her husband also works and they help one another.

Mariana is a very hardworking and enterprising individual who wants to get ahead. She is striving to improve her living conditions. Mariana is requesting this loan to buy supplies such as vegetables, fruits, canned food, and other items in order to continue with her selling.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, canned food, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.es:
Asuncion tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con una hija en el distrito de Zaña, en una zona rural donde la vida es tranquila y serena, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura y crianza de animales, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, realiza esta actividad desde hace 3 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este negocio, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales para incrementar su negocio, con esto ella espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes satisfaciendo sus gustos y necesidades lo que le generará ingresos mayores que van a permitirle mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Asuncion is 49 years old, is a single mother, and lives with her daughter in the Saña District, a rural area where life is calm and serene. The residents there primarily work in agriculture and animal husbandry. It is located in the Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Region, on the northern coast of Peru.

She works in the raising and sale of animals such as chickens, ducks, turkeys, among others. She has been doing this for the past 3 years, which is why she has experience in this trade. Her business is located in the back of her house.

She requests a loan to purchase a greater amount of animals so she can expand her business. With this she hopes to offer a greater variety of animals to her clients, satisfying their needs and preferences, which will generate more income for her and will allow her to improve the quality of life for her family and herself.

loans.use: to purchase a greater amount of animals so she can expand her business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Vilma works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell pottery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store and buy and sell charcoal.  Vilma is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional pottery to sell in her stall.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional pottery to sell in her stall

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida works hard to support her family. Zenaida is married and has a buy and sell recycled materials business in the Philippines.

Zenaida requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of recycled materials to sell.

Zenaida has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of recycled materials to sell and thus expand her business

loans.name: Edelita

texts.en:
Edelita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with nine children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. and is borrowing PHP 10500 through NWTF in order to buy more livestock and sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Edelita dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to buy more livestock and sell.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra is 27 years old and married with two children.  With one child still in school, Myra works very hard to provide for them.

Myra runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other personal care products to sell.

Myra has been in this business for 5 years. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other personal care products to sell

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita is 65 years old and has seven children. She is a widowed woman.

Charita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Charita has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Charita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a bakery shop business in the Philippines.

Valentina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Valentina has been in this business for three years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 50 years old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her two sons and two daughters, who are in school. Her husband has been running his own business of clothes selling for 10 years and he is responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household. 

Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore Razia is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Razia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to assist her husband's needs to increase his clothing business, by buying inventory

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is 61 years old and has five children. Esperanza is married woman.

Esperanza is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Esperanza requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs & other supplies to raise livestock.

Esperanza has been raising pigs for 6 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Esperanza would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs & other supllies to raise livestock

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel es una persona muy trabajadora que ayuda a su familia y a sus seres queridos, el trabaja en el flete de productos variados, esta poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Comenta que su préstamo anterior le fue de mucha ayuda ya que con ello pudo mejorar su trabajo.
Angel pide este préstamo nuevo para poder comprar cubiertas nuevas para su camión y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Angel is a very hardworking individual who helps his family and his loved ones. He makes a living shipping various products. He is putting in his best effort to continue with his work. Angel says that the previous loan was very helpful since he could improve his work with it. Angel is requesting another loan to buy new tires for his truck and thus continue working as he has been doing.

loans.use: to buy new tires for his truck.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Valientes está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, a su vez están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza como un medio de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y ayudar a sus familias.
Todas son mujeres muy emprendedoras que están luchando para poder mejorar cada día, entre quienes se destaca la Sra. Glady, quien cada día empieza su jornada de trabajo muy temprano, que es cuando se levanta a hacer sus comidas y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante, y por medio de sus ventas ayuda a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos, y otros, y así seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo y también luchar con ello sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres Valientes [Courageous Women] is in its 4th cycle of the women's committee program.  In turn, they are part of the program for the elimination of poverty as a means of improving their life conditions and help their families.

They are all women entrepreneurs who are struggling to be able to get ahead every day.  

Glady stands out among them.  Every day she starts her workday very early, which is when she wakes up to make her meals to later sell as a street vendor.  Through those sales she is able to support her family.

She is requesting this loan to purchase supplies to make her meals, such as vegetables, meat, seasonings, and others, and thus continue with her sales as she has been doing and be able to achieve a better income.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, meat, condiments and other supplies to make meals for sale.

loans.name: Sanavar

texts.en:
Sanavar is a communicative woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1958. She is living in a small town with her family. She is widowed and has one child with a daughter-in-law and grandson.

For almost 16 years, she has done a business and has a good practice. After the death of her husband, she started to do business in order to ensure her family. She does a business of buying and selling sweets and cakes. Her son helps her to import the goods to her store.

She is satisfied to do such business and is proud that she works honestly. She is informed and knows Kiva and wishes to work with them. She is planning to widen her assortment and asks for a loan to buy sweets and cakes for her store.

She awaits Kiva lenders’ kindness.

loans.use: to buy sweets and cakes for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 43 years old and married with three children. With her three children in school, Emelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Emelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as junk foods, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Emelyn has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Emelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as junk foods, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 61 years old and widowed with two children. Luciana works very hard to provide for them.

Luciana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like dried fish, sugar, condiments and other groceries.

Luciana has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap and other groceries.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

In the future, Luciana would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like dried fish, sugar, condiments and other groceries.

loans.name: Wetecia

texts.en:
Wetecia is 53 years old and has four children. She is married and has one child in school.

Wetecia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Wetecia has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Wetecia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is the responsible mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 8 years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi, because the current condition of his taxi is not good.  It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. 

Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to do the maintenance on his taxi. Therefore Naseem has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Naseem's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide the better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Naseem  also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.
Naseem is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: pay for maintenance on her husband's taxi

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 37 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Rosalie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Rosalie has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon, is aged 45, married to a carpenter/farmer and they're blessed with two children. She cook and sell rice cakes in their village for almost five years and earns a net income of PHP 10,000 a month. 

Due to insufficient capital on her business, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 13,000 to purchase rice grains, milk, butter, sugar, and rice cakes container to use in her food vending business. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more productive so that she can earn more income for the benefit of her family.

loans.use: To purchase rice grains, milk, butter, sugar, and rice cakes containers to use in her food vending business.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus cuatro menores hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el Distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en la región de Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva café variedad catimore, esta actividad la realiza en terreno de su propiedad. También se dedica a cultivar caña de azúcar, y a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, con esto el espera obtener un café de mejor calidad lo que incrementará sus ventas y le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 36 years old. He lives with his spouse and their 4 young children. They live in their own house made of rustic material in the Callayuc district, a community whose residents make a living in agriculture and raising livestock. It is located in the Cajamarca region, which is in the northern mountains of Peru.

Jose works in agriculture, cultivating Catimor coffee. He does this activity on his own land. He also grows sugar and raises and sells cattle. Jose will use this loan to buy manure and fertilizer to maintain his coffee crops. With this, he hopes to obtain a better quality of coffee which will increase his sales and allow him to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer to maintain his coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay education fees

loans.name: Deyna

texts.es:
Deyna es estudiante está estudiando para poder ser profesora de danza paraguaya, es una persona dedicada a su labor y a sus estudios.
Aspira a seguir desarrollando sus conocimientos a través del estudio y acceder a un campo laboral que le sea sustentable.
Pide este préstamo para el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Deyna is a student who is studying to be a professor of Paraguayan dance. She is a person who is dedicated to her work and her studies. Deyna aspires to continue developing her knowledge through her studies and to enter a field of work that will be sustainable.

Deyna is requesting this loan to pay the university fees required for her career area, and having achieved that, to be able to continue with her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: pay her university fees.

loans.name: Fahriddin

texts.en: Fahriddin is a hardworking man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1955. He lives in a rural area. He is married and has four children. The standard of their living is hard and the only business that is best and common to do is agriculture. There are good conditions in the area where he lives to plant agricultural products. He has many years of practice in planting vegetables and cereals. He likes to work on the land and each season takes care of his land, cultivating and fertilizing. In the coming season he is planning to plant potatoes. He appealed to IMON and KIVA lenders to get a loan to buy potato seeds. He hopes to be supported by KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds

loans.name: Lory

texts.en:
Her name is Lory, 36, resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Rodrick, a machine operator and they have three children. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal, household needs and to send her children to school.

Lory operates a small variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 800 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business Lory is requesting a PHP 15000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items which she sells at her store. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings is their source to meet their daily expenses and to send her children to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Lory aims to expand her store to improve their quality of life. She prays for God's guidance and blessings for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase groceries, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 42 years old and married with six children.  With three children in school, Marissa works very hard to provide for them.

Marissa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marissa has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future Marissa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Glecy

texts.en:
Glecy runs a bakeshop. She sells a variety of bread to the locals in her neighbourhood.  She is a 39-year-old married woman with two young children. She has been engaged in a bakery for 7 years now. This is the source of her income. She needs capital to finance her livelihood.

Glecy is asking for a loan to to buy supplies like flour, eggs, sugar, margarine and assorted toppings. These ingredients will be used in making bread that will attract more buyers to come and purchase. Glecy will be able to augment her income and start to handle her income. 

In the future, she dreams of expanding her existing business and she is hoping to open another branch to become sustainable and be able to support the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy supplies like flour, eggs, sugar, margarine and assorted toppings

loans.name: Hayriniso

texts.en: Hayriniso is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1971. She is living in a district with her family. She is divorced and has three children. She works in the government. In order to feed her children she works hard and tries to educate them. Her son is going to enter University. Hayriniso promised to educate her child and decided to get a loan from IMON to pay the higher education costs of her son. She is hoping to be supported by KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to pay the higher education costs of her son

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is 57 years old, married, and has eight children. 

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Virgie has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and she has borrowed from NWTF five times in the past to sustain her business.

In the future, Virgie would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 53 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Juanita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future Juanita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Pukhraj

texts.en:
Pukhraj is a 53-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her one son. Her husband has been running the business of clothes selling for 6 years, her husband is only responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household. Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore Pukhraj is applying for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, to assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Pukhraj is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's cloth business

loans.name: Gerelyn

texts.en:
Gerelyn is 48 years old, a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Gerelyn has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. Gerelyn requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more items like blouses, pants, bags and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Gerelyn has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Gerelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like blouses, pants, bags and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana esta estudiando la carrera de enfermería, esta poniendo todo de si para poder ser una profesional exitosa que pueda ser útil a las demás personas. Comenta que con su préstamo anterior pudo comprar algunos materiales para poder seguir con sus estudios.
Ana esta agradecida por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Ana is studying to be a nurse. She is giving her all so that she can become a successful professional who can be useful to others. She told us that with her last loan she was able to buy some new materials which allowed her to continue her studies. 

Ana is grateful for the new opportunity she has received which will be of great help to her. She is requesting this loan to pay for her university fees so she can continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Carloman

texts.es:
Carloman tiene 55 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Pomahuaca una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café, frutales, arroz, al comercio de los mismos y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes y abonos que le permitan brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café y de esta manera ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor producción lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Carloman is 55 years old and lives in the district of Pomahuaca, a hot climate community. The people in this community work in agriculture, growing and selling coffee, fruit and rice in particular and raising and selling cattle. They are located in the province of Jaén which is part of the Cajamarca region in the northern mountain range of Peru.


Carloman works as a farmer and grows coffee in particular. He has had a lot of experience in this business and he has steady customers who have given him good personal and work references. Carloman has requested a loan to buy fertiliser and compost so he can maintain his coffee crops. In this way he will be able to offer his clients a better product which will have a positive impact on his income level and, in turn, improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and compost to help him maintain his coffee crops

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 55-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband owns a printing shop, her husband is the guardian of the family and responsible to fulfill the need of all family members. Razia has been running her own beauty salon for the past 7 years, she also contributes her income with her husband's to manage the household. 

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics (e.g. creams, hair brushes, and other accessories) for her beauty salon but due to financial constraints she is not able to buy these items. Therefore Razia has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business so that she can provide better services to her customers; it will also help her to earn the maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance, Razia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: purchase cosmetics for her beauty salon

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 50 years old and has four children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Angelita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Angelita requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

Angelita has been raising pigs for 24 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Angelita would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 44 years old and married. She has five children, two of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marilyn has been raising pigs for four years now and has borrowed from NWTF five times in the past to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 42-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two sons and two daughters; her children are studying. Her husband has been running a business of clothes selling for 6 years; her husband is only responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household. Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore Nasreen is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan to assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to improve her husband's clothing business

loans.name: Abdulvose

texts.en: Abdulvose is a careful father. He was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1970. He is living in the district with his family. He is married and has three children. He is working as a driver at a private school. He spends his salary to provide for his family's needs, such as food and clothing. His son is getting an education in University and Abdulvose is responsible to pay his tuition fee. He appealed to IMON for financial support to pay his son's higher education costs. He awaits KIVA lenders' kindness.

loans.use: To pay his son's education fee

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 59 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Mercedes se dedica al servicio de transporte vía terrestre, desde hace más de 3 años. Su ruta es Pucará – Pandachi y viceversa. Mercedes necesita el crédito para realizar la compra de llantas, filtros, entre otros, y para el servicio de mantenimiento a su movilidad, así el espera mejorar los servicios que brinda asegurando de esta forma el correcto funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo para poder seguir generando sus ingresos propios lo que le va a permitir tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 59 years old and lives with his partner in the district of Pucará, a province of Jaén located in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountain range of Peru. His community mainly works in agriculture, raising cattle and trade.

Mercedes has worked providing an overland transport service for more than three years. His route is Pucará - Pandachi and return. Mercedes needs a loan to buy tyres, filters and other items and to service and maintain his vehicle.  With this he hopes to improve the service he provides and ensure that everything is working well with the tool of his trade so that he can continue to generate his own income which will allow him to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tyres, filters and other items and to service and maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Romelyn

texts.en:
Romelyn is 34 years old and married with four children.

Romelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Romelyn has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Romelyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Christine, who is 26 years old. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to benefit from training on savings, enterprise and financial management.

She runs a grocery shop to earn a living. She is borrowing to add more stock of kale and cabbage in her grocery. This will lead to more sales, thus more profits to provide for her basic needs like paying her house rent.  

Christine appreciates Kiva and her lenders and promises to repay back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cabbage and kale for her grocery shop

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Grace, 56 years old, married and blessed with five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to be trained on record keeping and how to manage finances.

She does dairy farming to earn her living. The skills she gained from the training have helped her to run the enterprise profitably. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy animal feed to increase milk production. This will help her get enough income to meet family demands.

Grace is grateful to Kiva and the lenders for the support and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: To buy animal feed that will help with milk production. This will improve her income and enable her to provide family needs with ease.

loans.name: Young Stars S.hg Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand is Hannah, 30 years old and a mother of two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HIH EA) in 2014 to benefit from the training, especially in enterprise development and financial management. 

She practices mixed farming by growing vegetables and keeping a dairy cow. She also runs a grocery business to supplement her income.  She is borrowing  to buy feed for her dairy cow, and more vegetables to add stock to her grocery shop for increased income. This will enable her to better provide food, clothing and education to her children.

Hannah is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and stock for her grocery shop

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Señor Juan es de la ciudad de Itá, está en el tercer año de la carrera de Ingeniería en Informática, comenta que está poniendo todo de sí para ser un buen profesional.
Juan está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para ser alguien en la vida y por medio de su trabajo poder abrirse camino.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Juan comes from the city of Itá. He is in his third year of Information Technology and tells us that he is giving his all to become a good professional. Juan is doing his best to be someone in life and he hopes that his job will pave the way for him to do that. He is applying for a loan to continue paying his university fees.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Diana works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Diana is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

Diana has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Upendo Kerwa Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand is Beth, 46 years old, married and living with her two children. She joined Hand in Hand in 2014 to benefit from savings, enterprise and financial management training. 

She does vegetable farming and operates a food cafe.  She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy certified seeds to boost her farming production. This will enable her to pay for her family's needs e.g. clothing, and school fees.

Beth is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy certified seeds to boost her farming production to enable her to pay for her family's needs e.g. clothing and school fees.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Damaris, 47 years old, married and a mother of six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to acquire knowledge on enterprise development and financial management.
 
Damaris sells second hand clothes. She is borrowing from Kiva to add more clothes to enable her to boost her business and earn more income to better the lives of her children and be able to pay school fees for them. 

Damaris is grateful to Kiva and the lenders and promises to pay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy more second hand clothes to boost her income to enable her to meet family expenses such as school fees.

loans.name: Ruqia

texts.en:
Ruqia is a 43-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her two sons and one daughter. Her children are studying.

Her husband has been running his own business selling clothes for five years. He is solely responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk to resell, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these clothes. 

Therefore, Ruqia is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Ruqia is very thankful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enable her husband to purchase clothes in bulk for his business

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, es estudiante del último año de la carrera de Farmacia, su mayor anhelo es terminar su carrera y poder ejercer su profesión para así poder tener que un mejor futuro que ofrecerle a su familia.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Gabriela comes from the city of Paraguarí and is studying her last year of Pharmacy. Her greatest wish is to complete her course and work in her profession so she can offer her family a better future. 

Gabriela is applying for a loan to pay for her course fees so she can continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay for her university fees

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer tiene 30 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad donde la vida es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican a la ganadería y agricultura, se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la de venta de repuestos y accesorios de motos, cuenta con una tienda de repuestos ubicada en su domicilio, cuenta con mas de 02 años de experiencia en el rubro, además cuenta con un taller donde brinda servicios de reparación y mantenimiento de vehículos, por su buen servicio cuenta con bastantes clientes quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El préstamo lo utilizará en la compra de una mayor cantidad de repuestos para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto el espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes lo que incrementará sus ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 30 years old, in a de facto relationship and lives in his own house with his wife and two children in the district of Pomahuaca.
