Life is peaceful in this community and its people work raising cattle and farming. It is located in the province of Jaén in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountain range of Peru.  

Wilmer works selling spare tyres and motor bike accessories and has a store where he sells his spare tyres in his home. He has had more than two years of experience in this trade and also has a workshop where he repairs and services vehicles. Due to his good service Wilmer has many customers who have given him very good personal and work references. 

This loan will be used to buy spare tyres in bulk to increase his store's stock. With this purchase Wilmer hopes to offer a greater variety of products to his customers which will increase his sales and, in turn, improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy spare tyres in bulk to increase his store's stock.

loans.name: Ambreen

texts.en:
Ambreen is a 42-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years and is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Ambreen is also providing sewing services and earning an income to contribute with her husband to manage the household. 

She needs different kinds of goods, e.g. needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above accessories and will help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Ambreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase needles, threads, pieces of cloth, and machine oil to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Ydubis

texts.es:
Ydubis tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus cinco menores hijos en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará, contando con servicios de agua y luz; dicho distrito esta ubicado en en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura y ganadería.

La actividad que realiza Ydubis es la venta de aves de corral como gallinas, patos, pollos, entre otros, la compra lo realiza en su caserío y la venta lo realiza en Pucará, cuenta con 5 años de experiencia en el rubro, además se dedica a brindar servicios como peón agrícola, ingresos adicionales que le permiten solventar el crédito sin ningún problema. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de aves de corral para incrementar el stock de su negocio, esto le generará mayores ingresos y así podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ydubis is 35 years old and lives with her partner and five youngest children in the rural area of the Pucará district which is connected to water and electricity. This district is located in the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountain range of Peru. The community mainly works in farming and cattle raising.

Ydubis sells poultry such as hens, ducks, chickens and others. She buys them in her village and sells them in Pucará. She has five years of experience in this field and she also offers her services as a farmhand. This additional income will allow her to repay her loan without any problems. 

This loan will be used to buy more poultry to increase her business's stock, which will generate a greater income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more poultry to increase her business's stock

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 41 years old and married with three children.

Grace works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Grace has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Grace aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
This is James who is 31 years old. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013. Since then he has undergone thorough enterprise and financial management training.

His main economic activity is carpentry and he is applying for a Kiva loan to buy more timber that will help meet customers' demands for furniture. This will lead to more income that will cater to his needs such as food and clothing.

He appreciates Kiva and the lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy timber that will boost his carpentry business.

loans.name: Magha Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand is Dorcas, 55 years old, married and blessed with seven children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training, especially in enterprise development and financial management.

She does dairy and vegetable farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy manure and farm inputs to boost production of vegetables and, hence, earn more income. 

Dorcas is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.  She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy manure and farm inputs to boost production of vegetables to earn more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy animal feed for increased milk production to meet his customers' demands.

loans.name: Josfeen

texts.en:
Josfeen is a 43-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years and he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Josfeen is also providing sewing services and earning an income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.
 
She needs different kinds of goods, e.g. needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above accessories and help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Josfeen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase needles, threads, pieces of cloth, and machine oil to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
18 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, cada una de ellas es una persona muy trabajadora que quiere salir adelante todo para poder mejorar sus vidas y dar a las personas que quieren una mejor calidad de vida.
La Sra. Mirna es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella se dedica a trabajar en hacer manicuras, es una mujer muy buena en lo que hace, y es por ello que tiene ya muy buena clientela que siempre le da mucho trabajo. Quiere seguir mejorando cada día para poder ir creciendo y ayudar a sus seres queridos como lo viene haciendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder seguir haciendo su trabajo de manicura, como ser esmaltes, acetonas, alicates y otros. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de crecer.
texts.en:
There are 18 women in this group, and each of them is very hardworking and wishes to move ahead, improving her life and the lives of her loved ones. 

Mirna is one of the members of this group. She works as a manicurist and is very good at what she does, so she always has good clientele and plenty of work. She wants to keep getting better every day in order to grow professionally and to help her loved ones, as she has already been doing. She is requesting this loan to buy supplies for her manicure business, such as nail polish, nail polish remover, clippers, and others. She is thankful for this opportunity to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, nail polish remover, and other manicure products.

loans.name: Villa Jardin Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Villa Jardín se formó en la ciudad de Itá, las integrantes forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, con el cual a  través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, irán mejorando su situación de pobreza.
Cinthia es una de las integrantes, quien por medio de su peluquería se gana la vida de una manera digna y honrada, es una mujer muy trabajadora que está poniendo todo de sí para poder ayudar a las personas que ella más quiere. Está poniendo todo de sí para poder salir adelante e ir mejorando con su negocio.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su peluquería, como ser shampoo, enjuagues, tintes, cremas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group called Villa Jardín was established in the city of Itá.  Its members belong to the elimination of poverty program in which through continued work and effort and the adoption of the essential behaviors of a successful woman, they will gradually improve their financial situation. 

Cinthia is one of the members, and through her hair salon she earns a living in a dignified and honorable way. She is a hard-working woman who is giving her all to be able to help the people she loves the most. She is giving her all to get ahead and to continually improve her business. She is asking for this loan so she can buy supplies for her hair salon such as shampoo, rinses, dyes, creams, etc. so that she can continue with her work as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, rinses, dyes, creams and other supplies to perform her work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a portable solar light kit to enhance her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her university fees in Psychology

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is married and blessed with three children. Her youngest child is attending school and her two older children have settled for marriage. For the past few months, Lydia has owned and run a variety store. She does not have enough capital to purchase assorted items.

Lydia is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan to purchase assorted biscuits, seasonings, juice drinks, and soft drinks. She hopes to improve her variety store to have better income for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, seasonings, juice drinks, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Sayyora

texts.en:
Sayyora is from the Bohtar district. She is 52 years old, married and the mother of two daughters. She is diligent woman.  

Sayyora purchases and sells children's clothing. She has two years of experience in this field. Through her work, her family lives well. 

At the moment Sayyora does not have new goods and does not have any clients. She wants to buy new clothes to sell, but does not have enough money. She lacks 950 TJS. Sayyora has high hopes for your help. Thanks in advance.

loans.use: to buy new children's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
The person in this photo is Beatrice. She is 28 years old and is married and blessed with three children. Beatrice joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HIH EA) in 2013 with the motive of gaining knowledge and skills about savings, enterprise development, and financial management. She is a bean farmer and has been able to improve her farming business due to the enterprise management training by HIH EA. Beatrice promptly repaid her first loan from HIH EA.

Beatrice is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to boost her farming business. Her loan will result in more income and she will be more easily able meet family needs such as school fees for her children. Beatrice is grateful to Kiva lenders and promises to pay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anum

texts.en:
Anum is a responsible mother with one child. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. For the past eight years, Anum’s husband has been a taxi driver. He is responsible for providing for the needs of the entire family. The current condition of the taxi is not good and it requires daily maintenance that Anum’s husband is unable to afford. 

Anum is requesting a loan through the Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband repair his taxi. With the help of her loan, her husband will be able to provide better transportation facilities to increase his income. Anum also plans to save some of the profit from her loan to meet her family's needs in future. She is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband repair his taxi

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Rosalie works hard to support her family. She sells prepared foods in the Philippines and earns additional income by raising pigs.

Rosalie has been supporting and building her business through her past six successful loans with Kiva's field partner NWTF. She is now borrowing 13,000 PHP to buy ingredients to make the food she sells.

Rosalie hopes that her hard work will help her to save enough money to continue developing her business and sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make the food she sells.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, fifty years old, is married and blessed with one child. He operates a café serving food and beverages.

Peter joined Hand in Hand Eastern African in 2013 and successfully underwent the training offered by the organization, which enabled him to improve his business through good recordkeeping and finance management. He is now borrowing 10,000 KES through Kiva's field partner HiH EA to buy coffee, sugar and milk for his cafe. This loan will help him meet his customers’ demands with ease, thus giving him more income to meet his family’s needs.

Peter is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to pay the loan back promptly.

loans.use: To buy coffee, sugar and milk that will help boost cafe business.

loans.name: Ma. Emily

texts.en:
Ma. Emily is 32 years old and married with two children. For the past four years, she has been raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Emily has borrowed eight previous loans from NWTF and Kiva to sustain her business. 

Ma. Emily is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Jenny Joana

texts.es:
Jenny es una joven de 24 años de edad, soltera quien vive en compañía de sus padres y su hermana, a su corta edad esta por finalizar sus estudios universitarios previo a obtener su título de licenciada en mercadotecnia.
Es una joven con muchas metas y sueños por alcanzar pero menciona que la situación económica para su familia no ha sido la mejor en los últimos días, ya que debido a esto tuvo que buscar un empleo que le permitiera costear su propia educación ya que su padre es el único de la familia que trabajaba y cubría con los gastos del hogar incluyendo los costos educativos de su hermana menor.
Es por eso que con esfuerzo Jenny ha decidido optar por el programa educativo y así poder finalizar sus estudios universitarios. Es una joven honesta, amable y muy alegre, desea formar parte del patrimonio juvenil que engrandecerá a Honduras mediante la preparación y aspiraciones futuristas que serán las ideales para apoyar a su familia a optar a un mejor nivel de vida.
Jenny recuerda esa ocasión en la que se encontró sin esperanzas de superarse, ya que desde que tenia 18 años de edad estuvo en busca de empleo por que su situación económica no le permitía aspirar a una preparación educativa, si no hasta dos años después, Dios le brindó esta nueva etapa en donde pudiera tener un empleo que le generara la oportunidad de estudiar y aportar a su familia en lo poco que puede.és y tener una mejor oportunidad de empleo que le permita adquirir sus propios bienes para brindarle un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Jenny is a young woman of 24, single and lives with her parents and her sister. She is about to complete her university studies at a young age before obtaining her degree in marketing. 

Jenny is a young woman with many goals and dreams but she tells us that her family's financial situation has not been the best lately, so because of this she has had to look for a job that would allow her to finance her own education. Her father is the only one in her family that works and covers the household costs, including the education fees for her little sister.

Due to this and after a lot of effort Jenny decided to opt for an educational program so that she could complete her university studies. She is an honest, kind and very happy young woman who wants to be part of a group of young people working to create a legacy that will enrich Honduras, thanks to their training and aspirations for the future. This will be the ideal way that she can support her family to achieve a higher standard of living.

Jenny remembers the time that she found herself lacking the motivation to go on. From the age of 18 she was looking for work because her financial situation prevented her from aspiring to educational training until two years later when God opened up a new chapter in her life. Jenny was able to get a job which gave her the opportunity to study and contribute to her family with the little that she had. She hopes to have better opportunities for employment which will allow her to acquire her own assets to offer her family a better future.

loans.use: to complete her university studies in marketing

loans.name: Shahoney Grace

texts.en:
Shahoney Grace is 25 years old, and married with one kid who is in school. 

Shahoney Grace is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more livestock to resell. 

Shahoney Grace has been raising livestock for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to resell.

loans.name: Noureen

texts.en:
Noureen is a 32-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband is a government servant, and he is the guardian of the family and manages the entire household. 

Noureen's husband has been running his own business as a rice wholesaler for the past eight years. He needs to buy rice bags in bulk and other commodities for reselling, but due to financial constraints, her husband is unable to purchase these commodities. Therefore, Noureen applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will assist her husband to buy these commodities for reselling to earn the maximum profitable income. This income will also help him to save in order to meet the needs of his family and business. Noureen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to assist her husband to buy rice and other commodities.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El Comité Divino Niño Jesus está dentro del programa de comité de mujeres, además forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, como un medio de poder mejorar sus vidas y las de sus seres queridos.
Una de las que integra este grupo es la Sra. Angelina, quien se dedica a las ventas ambulantes de todo tipo de productos, es muy buena en las ventas y es por ello que le está yendo muy bien. A través de las capacitaciones ella quiere  ir mejorando y creciendo para poder dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ellas necesitan.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas, artículos de bazar, calzados y otros productos para poder vender. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Comité Divino Niño [Divine Child Jesus Committee] is in the women's committee program. Also, they are part of the poverty eradication program as a means to improve their lives and those of their loved ones. 

One that integrates this group is Angelina, who is in street vending of all types of products. She is very good in sales and that is why she is doing very well. Through the training, she wants to improve and grow to give her loved ones everything they need.

Angelina is asking for this loan for the purchase of clothing, bazaar items, footwear, and other products to sell. She is thankful for the opportunity she receives of being able to continue with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy clothing, bazaar items, footwear, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Lilisita

texts.en:
Lilisita is 51 years old, and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Lilisita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store. She has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income by directly selling Avon products.

Lilisita aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
Fedelina is a married woman with six children. She is 65 years old and all six of her children are in school.

Fedelina is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Fedelina requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.

Fedelina has been in this business for 45 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Ermitaño

texts.es:
Ermitaño tiene 33 años, vive en casa de familiares junto a su conviviente e hija en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Zaña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de construcción en Zaña y zonas cercanas, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con clientes que brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. Adicionalmente se dedica al cultivo de maíz. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de nuevas herramientas para implementar su negocio, con esto el espera mejorar el servicio que brinda a sus clientes lo que le permitirá tener mayores ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ermitaño is 33 years old. He lives in the family home with his partner and daughter in a community devoted to commerce, agriculture and livestock-raising, located in Zaña district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region on Peru's north coast.

He works providing construction services in Zaña and nearby areas. He has experience in this business, and clients who provide very good work and personal references for him. In addition, he grows corn. 

He will use the loan to buy new tools for running his business.  With this he hopes to improve the service he provides to his clients, which will allow him to have greater income and therefore improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: To buy new tools for running his business.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 60 years old, and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Letecia has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients like spices, meat, dressed chicken and rice for her food-vending business.

Letecia has been in this business for 24 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like spices, meat, dressed chicken and rice for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 55 years old, and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Emma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, candies, detergent soap, sugar, coffee, etc. to sell.

Emma has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from food vending. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, candies, detergent soap, sugar, coffee, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Alishba

texts.en:
Alishba is a 35-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children and her husband owns a printing shop. Her husband is the guardian of the family and is responsible for fulfilling the family's needs.

Alishba has been running her own beauty salon for the past 5 years; she also contributes her income along with her husband's to manage the household.

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics, such as creams, a hair brush, and other accessories for her beauty salon, but due to financial constraints, she is not able to buy these items for her business purposes. Therefore, Alishba has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business so that she can provide better services to her customers, it will also help her earn the maximum income to fulfill the needs of her business and her family.

Alishba is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to increase her polar business

loans.name: Sarvinoz

texts.en:
Sarvinoz is a bright woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1995. She is married and lives in a rural area.

Since her childhood she has been accustomed to working in agriculture. She helps her parents by planting vegetables and cereals, and selling them in the domestic market. She is a helpful and supportive child in her family.

Her parents wanted her to be educated at university after graduating high school. After graduating with excellence, she entered university, but unfortunately the money that her family gains from agricultural work is not enough to pay her education fees. Thus, she appealed to IMON, asking for financial support from KIVA lenders in order to pay her education fees. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to pay for her education fees

loans.name: Novelyn

texts.en: Novelyn is a 29-year-old mother who has two children. She has owned and managed a general store within the public market for almost nine years. She aspires to make this business viable and more profitable in order to earn a higher income. To further improve the business, she needs additional capital of PHP 20,000 to buy more dresses, footwear, school supplies, bags and accessories to resell. She is hoping that someday she will improve her business and sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy more dresses, footwear, school supplies, bags and accessories

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Janet is 38 years old and both of her children are in school.

Janet has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Janet requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Janet has been in this business for four years. In the future, Janet would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 38-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband owns a printing shop, and he is the guardian of the family and responsible for fulfilling the needs of all family members. 

Naseem has been running her own beauty saloon for past five years, and she contributes her income to her husband to manage the household. She needs to buy different types of cosmetics, such as creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon. However, due to financial constraints, she is not capable to buy these items for her business purpose. Therefore, Naseem applied for Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business, so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also help her earn the maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

Naseem is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy different types of cosmetics, such as creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 59 years old, and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Cecilia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more seafood to sell. She has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Cecilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is grateful that she was granted a 20,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and afford their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan, which she will use as part of her working capital to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles and frozen foods, which she sells at retail. She knows that having more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source of income for her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her. 

Amy dreams of having a bigger General Store and aims to give her children a college education to allow them better opportunities in life. She prays for God's guidance and good health for her family. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is thankful that she was granted a PHP 8,000 loan which she used to pay for buns, hot dogs, and burgers needed in her snack stand. Her earnings helped cover her family's basic daily needs and send her children to school. 

She would like to apply for a PHP 15,000 loan which she will use to buy several pieces of buns, hamburgers, hot dogs, oil, and fuel needed to operate her burger house. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given to her and a good return on her investment for it will surely help meet their everyday needs and fund her children's school requirements. 

Erlinda aims to sustain and grow her business. She prays for God to abundantly bless her family and she hopes that they will have their own house someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for buns, burgers and hot dogs to sell at her burger stand.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 44 years old and married with four children. With four children still in school, Analie works very hard to provide for them.

Analie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, cooking oil, and personal care products.

Analie has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, cooking oil, and personal care products

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 44 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom is in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosie requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins.

Rosie has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is 42 years old and married with two children.  With two children currently in school, Erna works very hard to provide for them.

Erna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional grocery items to sell, like canned goods, shampoo, milk, coffee, noodles, coffee, and bread.

Erna has been in this business for three years.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items to sell, like canned goods, shampoo, milk, coffee, noodles, coffee, and bread

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a hardworking entrepreneur, with two children.

She earns a living by fishing in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

She supplements this income with earnings from selling fish.

Betty dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish her degree in telecommunications engineering

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
As the married mother of four children, Emelda works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling eggs in the Philippines.  She also earns income from buying and selling charcoal.  Emelda is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy more trays of eggs to sell..

Emelda has sustained her business activities through her past  loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving  enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more trays of eggs to sell in her business

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is married, with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Eufemia is 47 years old and has two children still in school.

Eufemia has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more boxes of fish to sell in the market.

Eufemia has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
La socia Yaneth pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YANAHUARA.
 La socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual  le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para  de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia Yaneth solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, leche entre otros.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Yaneth belongs to the "VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YANAHUARA" communal bank. She combines her daily activities with her grocery store business. She has been in the business for some time and things are going well for her thanks to the determination she brings to her business each day. She wants to be able to continue working in this way to support her family. Yaneth is requesting a loan to buy sugar and milk amongst others. She is grateful for those who form part of this dream through this loan and promises to comply with the payment of her installments within the establish times.

loans.use: to buy sugar and milk amongst others.

loans.name: Mehpare

texts.en:
Mehpare is 41 years old and married, with three children. Mehpare has worked in agriculture since she was very young, and she loves it. 

She was born and raised in a village, so she doesn't have a higher education.  Getting a decent job without an education is very difficult. She works hard every day to earn a living and offer better living conditions for her children.  Mehpara's husband is a master but he helps her in this business.

At the moment, though, she is having some financial difficulties.  That is why she decided to turn to Aqroinvest CU for financial support.  Crop prices are very low right now, so she cannot count on earnings from her harvest to buy seeds toward a future harvest.  

For this reason, she has decided to take a loan to buy seeds.  Her only hope is that Kiva will support her .

loans.use: to buy seeds for the next harvest

loans.name: Mamura

texts.en: Mamura is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1980. She is living in a remote town with her family. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a master and works to orders. She participated at a three-day training provided by IMON to startup clients. Now she is planning to open her business in agriculture. She wants to buy livestock and keep them to sell in the future. She is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to buy livestock and start doing a new business. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock and start doing a new business

loans.name: Tamer

texts.en:
Tamer is a 24-year-old single man from Tulkarm city. He works with his family on their agricultural land. They plant seasonal fruits and vegetables. Tamer and his six brothers cooperate in this work.

Tamer would like to improve his income and find an additional job, so he took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to start his own studio and buy a new camera. This will help him to improve his income and also his family's living conditions.

Tamer appears in the photo.

loans.use: to start his own studio and buy a new camera

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 55 years old, and married with no children. She sells rice and rice bran for income. Her spouse is a laborer.

She wanted to ask for additional capital of PHP 7, 000 to invest in buying more sacks of rice and rice-bran to sell.

She hopes to improve her sales and continue operating her business. This will help her achieve her dreams of financial stability.

loans.use: to invest in buying more sacks of rice and rice-bran to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 40 years old and has two children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jocelyn has been in the pig fattening business for 3 years now, and has borrowed from NWTF 2 times in the past to sustain it.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for raising her pigs

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 35-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband owns a printing shop. Her husband is the guardian of the family and is responsible for fulfilling the needs of all the family members. Rehana has been running her own beauty salon for the past 7 years, she contributes her income along with her husband's to manage the household.
 
She needs to buy different types of cosmetic products, such as creams, a hair brush, and other accessories, for her beauty salon, but due to financial constraints she is not able to buy these items for her business. Therefore, Rehana has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purposes so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also help her earn the maximum income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

Rehana is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products for her salon business

loans.name: Nicca Marie

texts.en:
Nicca Marie is 22 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Nicca Marie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of groceries to sell. Nicca Marie has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, spices, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Nicca Marie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Enma Georgina

texts.es:
A sus 52 años de edad, Enma es una persona que tiene un sentido de superación y motivación que nadie puede opacar, es madre, esposa, abuela y estudiante actualmente.
Obtuvo su título de secundaria en 1982, graduándose de Maestra en educación media con un indice de 86%, posteriormente inicio sus estudios universitarios y obtuvo su título como licenciada en pedagogía con un indice académico de 80%, actualmente se encuentra cursando la maestría en dirección de recursos humanos.
Enma menciona sus cualidades que la convierte ne en una persona excepcional y distinta a los demás y es que ella mantiene una actitud servicial con el prójimo, es amable y con muchas ganas de luchar por su vida, por sus hijos y por su familia.
Su motivación se centra en poder mejorar el nivel académico de sus alumnos y alumnas, ya que ama su trabajo y desea inculcar los mejores valores en cada uno de sus pupilos, desea transmitir el sentido de superación a sus hijos el cual siempre han estado a su lado para apoyarla y amarla ante toda situación hoy en día, aspecto que la hace sentirse orgullosa de la familia que ha formado en el transcurso de los años.
El poder continuar con una vida profesional y educativa a pesar de los obstáculos y tiempos difíciles económicamente en el país, para Enma es sinónimo de superación y muestras de contribución al desarrollo del país, ya que mediante la ocupación y el estudio muchas personas hacen productivas sus vidas.
Como planes a futuro, desea poder seguir impartiendo el pan del saber a todas aquellas personas que tienen deseos de aprender y de poder sobrellevar los momentos difíciles que actualmente se atraviesa en la sociedad, desea ser el mejor ejemplo para sus hijos y para los mas pequeños del hogar.
texts.en:
At 52 years of age, Enma is a person who has a motivation and desire for success that no one can overshadow.  She is a mother, wife, grandmother,and student.

She obtained her high school degree in 1982, graduating with a degree in education with an 86% grade average.  Later, she started her university studies and obtained a bachelor's degree in education with an academic index of 80%.  At this time, she is enrolled in a master's program in HR management.
Enma mentions the qualities that made her into an exceptional person who is different from the rest.  She maintains an attitude of service to others,she is kind, and has a strong desire to fight for her life, for her children, and for her family.

Enma's motivation is focused on improving the academic level of her students.  She loves her work, and wants to inculcate the best values in every one of her students.She wants to convey a sense of being able to overcome difficulties to her children, who have always been at her side to support her and love her through any situation.  This makes her proud of the family that she has formed over the years.

The power of continuing with her professional and educational life, in spite of the obstacles and difficult economic times in the country, is for Enma synonymous with success, and shows her contribution to the development of her country.  This is because through her occupation and study, many people have had productive lives.

In the future, Enma wants to continue to impart knowledge to those persons who have the desire to learn, and be able to overcome these difficult moments that society is going through at this time.  She wants to be the best possible example for her children and for the young ones in her household.

loans.use: to finish her postgraduate degree in human resources

loans.name: Erminda

texts.en:
Erminda is 53 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, noodles, etc.

Erminda has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, noodles, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Floredelina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Floredelina works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.  Floredelina is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, noodles, eggs, spices, chips, etc. for her general store business.

Floredelina has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, noodles, eggs, spices, chips, etc

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
La socia Jesusa continua  dedicando al negocio de venta de chicha de jora que es una bebida a base de maíz ,la socia lleva años dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar maíz entre otros.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Jesusa continues to work in her business selling chicha de jora, which is a corn based drink. She has been in this business for years and things are going well thanks to the determination she brings to her work each day. She wants to continue to work in this way to keep on supporting her family. She is requesting the loan to buy corn amongst others. She is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this loan and promises to comply with the payment of her installments within the established time.

loans.use: to buy corn amongst others.

loans.name: Ixtiyar

texts.en:
Ixtiyar is a 27-year-old farmer. He is married and has two daughters.  Ixtiyar works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. He has been involved in this business for more than seven years. His wife is helping him in this business, but their monthly income is not enough to cover their family's needs. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns him is not having a bathroom. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a bathroom.

Ixtiyar hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, and he hopes to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Placida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YANAHUARA.
La socia Placida tiene 46 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a trabajar en una empresa pública, la socia lleva buen tiempo trabajando para esta empresa la cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de víveres para su hogar como arroz, azucar, leche entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This partner belongs to the communal bank VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YANAHUARA.  

Placida is 46 years old has 3 children and is married.  She alternates her daily activities by working in a public company.  She has been working for this company for quite sometime and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts each day at work, thus being this the means by which she helps her family get ahead.  

This partner is requesting a loan to buy food for her household such as rice, sugar, milk and others.

She is grateful for the loan granted and agrees to comply with the agreed upon quotas.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her home such as rice, sugar, milk and others.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 47 years old, married and had three grown up children. She and her spouse are farmers, planting and harvesting rice to sell. She had been in her business for more than a decade and enjoys her farming business. 

She needs additional capital in her business that is why she is asking for a loan of P30,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides use in farming. She hopes this will help maintain a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides used in farming and to provide extra capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery items (eggs, biscuits, canned goods and softdrinks) to sell

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean works hard to support her family. Jean is married with one child and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Jean requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Jean has been in this business for two years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy-and-sell rice business.

Jovita has been in this business for one year. Jovita earns more income from food vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Rosa Marcela

texts.es: Marcela está casada, tiene 35 años de edad, Marcela y su esposo tienen 2 hijos, uno de 17 años y una chica de 14 años de edad, los dos están estudiando. Marcela y su esposo se dedican a trabajar al jornal y a la agricultura, Marcela solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de abono y fungicidas para cultivar su sembrío de frejol y otros productos que tiene en pequeños huertos. Marcela vive con su esposo y sus hijos asi que su aspiración es  mejorar su negocio y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos  para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Marcela lucha por el bienestar de sus hijos y porque  sigan estudiando.
texts.en: 35-year-old Marcela is married and has two children, a 17-year-old son and a 14-year-old girl. Both of her children are in school. Marcela and her husband work in agriculture. Marcela is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of fertilizers and fungicides to grow beans and other products in small patches of land. Her goal is to improve her business in order to increase her earnings and provide a better quality of life to her family. Marcela works hard for the wellbeing of her children and for them to obtain an education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and fungicides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Bernardete

texts.en:
Bernardete is requesting a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is married and she has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as a refrigerator, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, Fanta, beer, water, biscuits, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, salt, noodles and cards. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2012. She feels very comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Bernardete independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future. Her husband is a driver. She is happy with this loan because it will help to improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, Fanta, beer, water, biscuits, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, salt, noodles and cards

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is married and from Plaridel in the Philippines. She joined Paglaum MPC and appreciates the programs and services of the co-op. Because of her desire to sufficiently provide for her family, she has engaged in buying and selling assorted bread in their neighborhood. Lilia's source of income has existed for two years now. In need of additional working capital, she requested financial assistance from Paglaum MPC in the amount of PHP 8,000 to purchase more assorted bread to sell. In this way, she hopes to increase her sales and have more income so she is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. She is also happy that she can support the education of her children, which is her main priority of her hardship.

loans.use: to purchase more assorted bread to sell

location.town: Plaridel - Cartagena Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is 26 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is single with no dependents. Jared is a graduating student in college. He is helping his parents on his educational expenses by means of his income in e-load retailing business. He is earning an average monthly income of PHP 3,000 in doing this type of business

He has requested a loan to be used in paying the enrollment fees for this semester. Jared has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Jared hopes to expand his loading business.

loans.use: To be used in paying the enrollment fees for his education

loans.name: Rezeil

texts.en:
Rezeil is 43 years old and married. She lives with her husband and four children in Cartagena Proper, Plaridel. For the past twenty years, Emma and her husband had been farmers, focusing on a rice farm. Rezeil became an active member of PMPC in 2013. 

She is now requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer to have a heavier and higher crop yield on her rice farm. In the future.  She hopes to expand and improve her business to improve the general living conditions of her family and provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer so to have a heavier and higher crop yield on her rice farm

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 48 years old and lives in Lopez Jaena, Philippines. She is married with three school-age children. She is a farmer who wants to start a piggery. 

Evelyn has requested a loan to buy an additional five piglets, feed and build a concrete pig pens to start the business. She has been a member of PMPC for years. In the future, she wants to raise healthy pigs to earn more money for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional five piglets, feed, and build a concrete pig pens to start the business

loans.name: Guzman

texts.es:
Guzman tiene 35 años, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en el distrito de Querocotillo, provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de maiz amarillo, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 15 años y con buenas referencias por parte de los pobladores de su distrito. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para la cosecha de su cultivo, esto lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto lo que le generará ingresos mayores que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Guzman is 35 years old and lives in his own home, made of rudimentary materials, with his wife and 2 children.  They live in the Querocotillo district of the province of Cutervo, in the Cajamarca region of the northern highlands of Peru.  The residents of this area work mainly in agriculture, commerce, and livestock production.

Guzman is a farmer who cultivates yellow corn.  He has 15 years of experience in this line of work, and has good references from the residents of his district.  He will use this loan to pay for farm labor, and the for application and incorporation of phyto-sanitary products and fertilizers for his crops.  This will help his crops both physiologically and morphologically, and will give him a better harvest.  As a result, he will have greater production and better quality products, making it easier to sell and obtain more income.  This way,he can improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to pay for farm labor and agricultural products

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 39 years old and married with two children. With two children still in school, Lorena works very hard to provide for them.

Lorena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, and personal care products. Lorena has been in this business for four years.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, and personal care products

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 48 years old and married with one child. With one child still in school, Amelita works very hard to provide for them.

Amelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, spices, noodles, and bread.

Amelita has been in this business for three years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, spices, and noodles, bread

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
Fedelina is a 45-year-old single woman. Fedelina has a photography business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional camera for her business.

Fedelina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Fedelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional camera for her business

loans.name: Margielyn

texts.en: Margielyn works hard to support her family. Margielyn is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Margielyn requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business. Margielyn has been in this business for three years now. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Fadia's Group

texts.en:
Fadia is 46 years old, she is a caring mother and lives in the south of Jordan in Aqaba.

Fadia is working with a low income, and she has a daughter named Lubna, 25 years old, working in a beauty salon.
Fadia and her daughter Lubna opened their business which is a beauty salon located at their home, to increase their incomes and to improve the standards of living for their family.

Now they want to expand and develop their project, therefore they applied for a group loan to buy new supplies for their salon and do more promotions to attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy new supplies for their salon and do more promotions to attract more customers.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with seven children.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like pig fattening.

Josephine dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell, to save enough to send her children to college

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is 60 years old with one child.  Isabelita works very hard to provide for them.

Isabelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, beverages, and other groceries.

Isabelita has been in this business for 20 years now. 

In the future, Isabelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, beverages, and other groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials like fishing nets and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 42-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her 3 children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years; her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Shaheen is also providing sewing services and earning income to contribute, along with her husband's, to managing the household.
 
She needs different kinds of goods, for example, needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil, etc. for her business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these items and will also help her to increase monthly sales and profits by providing better sewing services.

Shaheen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy items for her tailoring business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in: a gate, cement, sand, iron and labor to install a gate and metal screening around her home.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 47 years old, married, and has nine children, five of whom attend school. Her spouse is a farmer. Before, Regina managed a small store but decided to stop it for the meantime due to unstable income and engage herself in buying and selling rice and corn. She resells it to traders in their village. 

She hopes to avail a loan of 7,000 PHP as additional revolving capital in her business. From her capital, she will be able to buy more sacks of rice and corn to sell for profit. 

Someday, with enough revolving capital, she will improve her business and save funds for educational purposes.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice and corn.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is grateful that she was granted a 20,000 PHP loan that she used for her van's maintenance, and also for mineral water which she sells at a retail price. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for continuous maintenance of her van. It is important that her van is always in good running condition for safety and for efficient service. Her earnings from her transport service will definitely help sustain her family's daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Mercedita hopes to buy another unit of UV (utility van) to better serve more commuters. She prays for God's travelling mercies for all the trips of her van service. She dreams to see all of her children become professionals someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts, accessories, and maintenance for her vehicle, and to pay for gallons of mineral water to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 45 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom are in school.

Evelyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. Evelyn has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to  raise her livestock

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 45, married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell like can goods, cereals, milk, coffee, etc.

Perla has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell, like can goods, cereals, milk, coffee, etc

loans.name: Ivy Cristy

texts.en:
Ivy Cristy is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ivy Cristy is 32 years old and has one child in school.

Ivy Cristy has a buy and sell beverages business in the Philippines. Ivy Cristy requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more beverages to sell.

Ivy Cristy has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Ivy Cristy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more beverages to sell, to provide a secure future for her family

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 49-year-old widowed woman and mother of five sons. After her husband died, she felt lost and confused. Her sons were still kids and it was hard for her to carry that responsibility at a young age. 

She started to buy blankets and sell them to the people around her home. Amal’s purpose of applying for the loan is to buy more blankets to sell to increase her income and save money to educate her sons. Amal's future plan is to develop her business and open a shop with blankets and clothes.

loans.use: to buy more blankets to sell to increase her income and save money to educate her sons

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa works hard to support her family. Rosa is married and has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

Rosa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell.

Rosa has been in this business for two years now.

Rosa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites works hard to support her family. Marites is married and has a beauty salon business in the Philippines.

Marites requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy material for her business.

Marites has been in this business for four years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy material for her business

loans.name: Mimela

texts.en:
Mimela is 60 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Mimela is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mimela has been farming sugarcane for 7 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies to secure the future of her family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig, to provide a secure future for her family

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina works hard to support her family. Rosalina is married and has a dried-fish-making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to make dried fish. Rosalina has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Edilma Marilza

texts.es: Edilma  reside en el campo y se dedica al jornal desde hace 20 años atrás, de allí es como aprendió a cultivar productos propios de su localidad. Edilma está casada y vive con su esposo que es jornalero y sus 3 hijos que están  estudiando, Edilma comenta que es muy difícil pagar los estudios de  sus 3 hijos ya que en el campo  se gana poco. Edilma solicita el dinero del crédito para comprar abono, fungicidas y para pagar de mano de obra para tener en buen estado sus cultivos. Edilma siembre cebolla, frejol, tomate de árbol y demás productos que se dan en las tierras de la  provincia en la que recide. Edilma tiene la aspiración de que sus cultivos sigan sanos y tener una buena cosecha. Edilma y su esposo trabajan duro para poder pagar los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en: Edilma lives in the countryside and has worked in agriculture for 20 years -- that is how she learned to grow her region's traditional products. Edilma is married and lives with her husband and their three children, who are all in school. According to Edilma, it is difficult to pay for her children's studies as people in the countryside don't make a lot of money. Edilma is requesting this loan to buy fertilizers, fungicides and to pay for the labor to keep her crops in good shape. Edilma grows onions, beans, tree tomatoes and other crops that are common to the region where she lives. Edilma hopes that her crops will stay healthy and to have a good harvest. Her and her husband work hard to be able to pay for their children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and fungicides.

loans.name: Dalayado Group

texts.en:
Abdiqadir is a 27 year old and he is not yet married. Abidqdir is the leader of the Dalayado Group which is a small group consisting of only two university graduates.  Abdiqadir who has the bag on his shoulder is the leader of this group. Abdiqadir and Mustafe are IT Technicians and they have an office in Hargeisa.

They have another opportunity to increase their income as they want to buy large umbrellas to rent in Hargeisa market for providing shade to small businesses.  Renting umbrellas as a small business is profitable and also don’t need other expenses.  

Abidadir and his group member requested $1500 from Kaaba Microfinance Institutions for a loan to buy umbrellas.  Abdiqadir will take $1000 and Mustafe $500. In the future they want to buy more umbrellas to get more profit.

loans.use: To buy large umbrellas to rent in Hargeisa market for providing shade to small businesses.

loans.name: Sonia Bithelma

texts.es: Sonia tiene 42 años, esta casada y tiene 3 hijas de 12, 18 y 19 años, la menor de sus hijas asiste a  la escuela y las 2 mayores están esperando tener los recursos económicos para ingresar a la universidad. Sonia y su esposo viven del trabajo del jornal y de la siembra de productos que se dan en donde ella reside. Sonia solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de fungicidas y  abono para curar y mantener buenos sus cultivos. Sonia siembra frejol, cebolla, papas entre otros productos. Sonia tiene la aspiración de hacer buenas cosechas y con las  ganancias que le queden cierta parte va a volver a invertir, otra parte para las cuotas del crédito y lo que le resta es para pagar de la educación de sus hijos y asi es como va saliendo con sus gastos. La aspiración de Sonia es que ojala su negocio le deje los recursos económicos necesarios para matricular a sus hijas a la universidad.
texts.en:
Sonia is 42 years old, is married and has three daughters aged 12, 18 and 19, the youngest daughter attends school and the 2 older ones are hoping to have the financial resources to enroll in university. 

Sonia and her husband make a living from wage labor and from planting products which grow in the area of residence.  

Sonia is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of fungicides and fertilizer to cure and maintain good crops. 

Sonia plants beans, onions, potatoes and other products. Sonia hopes to have a good harvests so that with the profits that are left over, a certain part will be invested again, some of it will be used to repay the loan, and with  the remainder she will pay for her children's education.  This is how she gets ahead with her expenses.  

Sonia dreams are that, hopefully, her business will allow the financial means with which to enroll her daughters in university.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and fungicides

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina is a 30-year-old lady, who lives with her husband and two sons in the small village of Alipurduar in their own small house. Her sons are reading in the local village school. Rina has a primary education up to grade 4. She is involved in a clothing business, and her husband is a cycle rickshaw puller by profession. He gives transportation services to the local people. 

A cycle rickshaw is a very common vehicle widely used in rural areas of India to carry people from one place to another. Her husband’s rickshaw is rented from a local owner. But it doesn’t provide sufficient income for the family. So he wants to purchase a cycle rickshaw of his own. But money is the main problem. So, as a responsible wife, Rina came forward and applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS). With this loan money, she will buy a cycle rickshaw for her husband’s transportation business. Rina hopes that she will earn more profit with this business and will be able to provide better education to her sons. 

Rina and her husband are very much thankful to their lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
El socio  pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YANAHUARA.
 El socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de venta de pasteles, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual  le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para  de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio  solicita el crédito para la compra de tortas entre otros.
El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: This partner belongs to the "Virgen del Carmen de Yanahuara" communal bank. He alternates his daily activities with the baking of cakes. He has spent quite a long time working on this business and does well thanks to the effort his puts into it every day. He wants to be able to continue working to support his family. He is requesting the loan to buy cakes and other things. The partner thanks those who are part of this dream through the Kiva website and promises to repay the loan in the established time.

loans.use: para la compra de tortas entre otros.

loans.name: Maria Amparo De Lourdes

texts.es: A sus 49 años de edad María es una señora trabajadora que se dedica al jornal de trabajos de agricultura y a la crianza de animales menores, el esposo de  María  trabaja al jornal de trabajos del campo. María tiene 4 hijos que ya son mayores de edad. María vive en una casa por la  que paga arriendo junto a su esposo y un hijo de 23 años y trabaja al jornal. María solicita el dinero del crédito para comprar cuyes. María tiene la aspiración de mejorar su negocio y junto a su  esposo lograr comprar una casita aunque sea a la vejez para mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
At the age of 49, Maria is a hard-working woman who spends her working hours in agriculture and in raising small animals. Maria's husband does day work in the fields. Maria has four children who are already adults. Maria lives with her husband and her son, who is 23 and does day work, in a house for which she pays rent. 

Maria is applying for the money from the loan to buy guinea pigs. Maria has the aspiration to improve her business and, along with her husband, to manage to buy a little house, even if it's in their old age, to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, metal sheeting, and purlins to build the corridor and put a roof on the washing area

loans.name: Heidy

texts.es:
Heidy es una mujer de 30 años de edad, soltera, tiene 1 hijo varon de 8 años y una hija mujer de 5 años, y su negocio es el transporte.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, optimista, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’ un área rural caracterizada por ser el centro de acopio de la producción agrícola como; frutas, verduras, carne, etc., y por sus parques eco-turísticos y educativos como una alternativa a los urbanos y tradicionales. De clima templado durante todo el año con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 7-23 grados centígrados.
