Heidy es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado estilo cola de caballo, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Quechua que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos; su hijo estudia en la escuela, su hija aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en una casa herencia de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba eléctrica, no existe el alcantarillado. Su negocio es el transporte; hace 2 años se compró un vehículo el cual lo maneja un chofer y le entrega una renta diaria. El vehículo trabaja como taxi y recorre las zonas rurales del área, dónde los caminos son de tierra y La zona en donde vive recientemente accedió a conexión de agua potable,  “mi vehículo me da una renta, el resto del tiempo lo ocupo realizando negocios de temporada y recién después de muchos años vamos a poder acceder a agua potable…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que el transporte tiene gran demanda en el lugar porque las distancias son largas, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para la conexión de agua potable. Su sueño es contar con agua potable en su hogar, ella desea realizar la conexión de agua potable en su cocina baño y lavandería para que sus hijos crezcan sanos y fuertes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Heidy solicita un préstamo para la conexión de agua potable en su cocina baño y lavandería para que sus hijos crezcan sanos y fuertes.
texts.en:
Heidy is a woman of 30. She is single and has an 8-year-old son and a 5-year-old daughter. Her business is transportation.

She is a good mother, entrepreneurial, optimistic, persistent, responsible, and very hard-working. She operates her business in the Sacaba area, a rural area characterized by being the collection center for agricultural products such as fruits, vegetables, meats, etc., and for its ecotouristic and educational parks, as an alternative to the urban and traditional [parks]. It has a mild climate throughout the year, with a temperature that varies during the day between 7 and 23 degrees centigrade.

Heidy has a dark complexion, brown eyes, long black hair that she ties in the style of a pony tail, short stature, and a thin physical build. Her maternal language is Quechua, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish for general culture and for her business. She shares her life with her children. Her son is in school. Her daughter is not yet of school age. They live in a house inherited from her family that is made of bricks and cement with a tile roof and dirt floor. It has electricity and potable water provided by an electrical pump. There is no sewer system. 

Her business is transportation. Two years ago she bought a vehicle that a driver operates, and he pays her a daily rent. The vehicle serves as a taxi and goes through the rural zones of the areas, where the roads are dirt. The zone where she lives recently gained access to a potable water connection. "My vehicle gives me an income. The rest of the time I use it doing seasonal business, and recently, after many years, we are going to be able to have access to potable water, " she comments. The advantage of her business is that transportation has great demand in the area, because the distances are long. The problem is the lack of money for the connection to potable water. Her dream is to have potable water in her home. She wants to make the connection to potable water in her kitchen, bathroom, and laundry so that her children can grow up healthy and strong. This is her first loan with the institution in the two years that she has had this business.

It is for these reasons that Heidy is applying for a loan for the potable water connection in her kitchen, bath, and laundry so that her children can grow up healthy and strong.

loans.use: to pay for the potable water connection in her kitchen, bath, and laundry so that her children can grow up healthy and strong.

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala is 39 years old and married with 3 kids. She has been selling children's clothes at a trade center for seven years. Her husband now makes and sells wood crafts after his employment at construction company ended. Their daughters both go to high school. 

She is requesting a loan of 1,500 AZN to buy children's clothes from Baku at a low price. She will sell these clothes and make a profit during the Children's Day Festival, which is celebrated on June 1st of every year. The borrower is a hardworking woman who mainly supports her family.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna lives at Cordova with her family. She is 51 years old and has four grown-up children. She and her spouse are farmers. In the rice field, they plant and harvest rice to sell.  

Edna wants to develop a good harvest but has insufficient funds now. That is why she is asking for a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides used to nourish crops and maintain her farming business. Someday, she hopes to improve her earnings and finally achieve income stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 46 years old and married with seven children. She earns a living by farming watermelon in the Philippines. Julie is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies. 

Julie has been farming watermelon for ten years and also earns income from poultry. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of fertilzer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ma. Ana

texts.en:
Ma. Ana is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Ana is 45 years old and both of her children are in school.

Ma. Ana has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

She has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Ma. Ana would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Tiefolo's Group

texts.fr: Tiefolo qui se trouve sur la photo portant le t-shirt verte a droite dernier rangé, est membre d’un groupe de 21 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Ouaramadiana au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Tiefolo, âgé de 46 ans, est le père de 7 enfants âgés de 1-14 ans, et dont l'1 d’entre eux est actuellement scolarisé.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Tiefolo à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 32 ans. Tiefolo cultive l'arachide, le mais, le mil sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles, d'engrais de qualité et d'herbicides. Tiefolo entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est réinscrit en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité, ainsi que des formations et techniques agricoles. Cette année Tiefolo effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture de maïs  afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 1 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 30 ans que Tiefolo cultive le maïs pour sa valeur vivrière. Tiefolo planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage comme et de pouvoir faire du commerce. Enfin Tiefolo espère aussi pouvoir construire une maison pour la famille ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille
texts.en:
Tiefolo is pictured in the back row wearing a green t-shirt.  He is part of a group of 21 farmers signed up with myAgro. He lives and works in the village of Ouaramadiana, located to the southwest of Bamako in Mali.

Tiefolo is 46 years old and the father of seven children between the ages of 1 and 14. One of his children goes to school.  The family is anchored in a tradition of farming, which is their main source revenue and dietary self-sufficiency. This has motivated Tiefolo to work in farming for 32 years. 

Tiefolo grows peanuts and corn on his land, but has to deal with challenges like a lack of farming equipment, fertilizer, and herbicides. Tiefolo is starting his second year with myAgro. He signed up again because of their payment system, quality seeds, and their farming education and techniques. 

This year Tiefolo is buying a packet of myAgro fertilizer to grow corn and increase the yield on his one-hectare parcel of land. He has been growing corn for some 30 years for its production value. 

With the increase in his yield and revenue, Tiefolo wants to start livestock farming, to build a house for his family, and to secure his family’s dietary self-sufficiency.

loans.use: buy a packet of myAgro fertilizer to grow corn.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is thankful that she was granted a 20,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her General Store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 35,000 PHP loan which she will use to purchase large quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, beverages, instant noodles, toiletries, which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Marivic dreams of having a bigger General Store. She aims to give her children a College Education to allow them better opportunities in life to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, beverages and toiletries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar lighting system for her business.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia works hard to support her family. Ofelia is married and has a business selling fruit in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now. 

Ofelia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fruit, such as bananas, watermelon, melons, mangos, etc. to sell in the market.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruit, such as bananas, watermelon, melons, mangos, etc. to sell in the market.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 45 years old and is married with two children. With one child in school, Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years now. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, personal care products, beverages, and other groceries.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, personal care products, beverages, and other groceries.

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en: Rahila is 58 years old and married with no children. She is in the poultry business. Rahila earns money by selling eggs and chickens to regular customers and neighbors. She wants to grow her business and has applied to Aqroinvest for a 1,200 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) loan to buy more chickens to raise and sell for profit. She says great thanks to Kiva and all the lenders for aid. In the future Rahila wants to own a poultry enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to raise and sell for profit.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 46 years old and lives in Guintomoyan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has five children who are now in their teens and school-aged. 

Edna has serves as an elected barangay (village) official in her community for several terms. She also earns income from agri-business, particularly pig fattening. Edna earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month from her business activities, an amount that is very beneficial to meet her family's needs.

She has requested a loan to purchase four piglets and four sacks of booster feed for her business. Edna has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Edna hopes to expand her pig fattening business by establishing an additional pig pen at her house.

loans.use: to purchase four piglets and four sacks of booster feed.

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en:
Cecil is 54 years old and is married with five children. Cecil works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Cecil has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from selling fish.

Cecil aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more food to offer his customers and redecorate his restaurant so as to attract more clients.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a hardworking entrepreneur with six children. She earns a living by growing watermelon in the Philippines, and supplements this income with earnings from her raising pigs.

Florence is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers.

She dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is 27 years old and married with one daughter. Rita is a sweet and responsible woman who has always known how to maintain comfort, warmth and convenience at home for her family. She does not have a higher education, but she has the talent of sewing women's national dresses. She can sew a simple one in a day, even though she needs to manage the house and look after her child. Rita finds time to do everything. She wants to take a loan to buy a sewing machine and other sewing accessories. She  has decided to increase her income and improve living conditions for her child.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and other sewing accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for increased milk production and supply to clients so as to meet family and client needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as increase the number of litres of milk supplied to clients daily.

loans.name: Hurshid

texts.en:
Hurshid is a handsome man who was born in northern Tajikistan to a family of workers. He is married and lives in the village of Dj.Rasulov with his family.

A student at the university, Hurshid is an active participant in class and well known among friends and other students. This is his third year at school and he is striving to graduate with excellence.

Unfortunately, Hurshid hasn’t enough money to pay his upcoming tuition fees. He has applied for a 1,750 TJS loan through Kiva's field partner IMON to pay his higher education costs. He hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to pay his upcoming tuition fees.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 59-year-old married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Judith has a food vending business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for eleven years. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Judith would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, 57, is a farmer from the Central province of Kenya. John is happily married and he and his wife are going to be celebrating their 20th anniversary this year. The couple is blessed with 8 children, aged between 12 and 36. 

John has been able to provide for his family through engaging in farming activities for the last two decades. His 6 acre farmland has 2 dairy cows, 500 heads of poultry, 100 trees, and a well that provides water for all those lives. He is seeking a loan of KES 100,000 which will enable him to buy more feed for the animals, a water tank to store clean water, and a poultry coop to house more poultry as they reproduce. 

Animal welfare is top on John's priority list, and with your loan, his animals will have proper nutrients, clean water to drink, and a housing for the hens - all prerequisites for achieving his vision.
  
John is rated as 'excellent quality' by Juhudi Kilimo's credit risk department. He successfully serviced his first loan of KES 65,000 and now he is applying for the second.  He is extremely likely to repay on time, and in regular installments, as no major risks were identified during borrower appraisal. He keeps a weekly budget and continually monitors his expenses. 

This loan is John's shot at improving his family's livelihood.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, a water tank, and a hen house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm tools and inputs for a better harvest to sell in the market and for family use.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is thankful that she was granted a 16,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her General Store. Through her earnings she was able to meet her family's daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan which she will use to purchase more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, frozen foods which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Eufemia dreams of having a bigger General Store to serve and attract  more customers. She prays for God to prosper her business and bless them with a happy family. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Cecilia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecilia is 40 years old and is married with six children. With four children in school, Ma. Cecilia works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Cecilia has been running a general store in the Philippines for five years. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, beverages, home product care, personal care products and other groceries.

In the future, Ma. Cecilia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, beverages, home product care, personal care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Marie Ysabelle

texts.en:
As a parent of two children, Marie Ysabelle works hard to support her family.

She has a processed food business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tailoring. Marie Ysabelle is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Marie Ysabelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
Bebelyn is a 56-year-old married woman with seven children, two of whom are in school. 

Bebelyn is a very hard  working entrepreneur. She has been running a business buying and selling fruit for 16 years. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fruit to sell.

In the future, Bebelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruit to sell.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is 55 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom is in school.

Helena is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been fattening pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. Helena has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Helena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 59 years old and is married with four children.

Marivic works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, personal care products and other groceries.

Marivic has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from bicycle transport.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like beverages, personal care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Luis

texts.pt: O senhor Luis é casado maritalmente, pai de 3 filhos dos quais 2 são gémeos do sexo masculino e uma menina de apenas dois anos. É cliente da instituição há sensivelmente 2 anos. Com o valor financiado a cliente pretende comprar material de construção nomeadamente: 30 sacos de cimento, 15 carrinhas de pedra, 14 ferros varrão 8 mm, 25 estribos e  pagar a mão-de-obra de fabrico de blocos. Do momento seu maior objectivo é iniciar sua obra pois encontra se a viver numa casa de construção precária. A nível profissional o cliente sente se satisfeito e gosta da profissão que exerce, a nível pessoal pretende num futuro breve abrir um negocio pra sua esposa que é domestica.
texts.en: Luis is married and has three children, two of whom are twin boys and one is a 2-year-old girl. He has been a client of the institution for about two years. With the amount of the loan he intends to purchase 30 sacks of cement, 15 truckloads of rocks, 14 iron rods and 25 stirrups, and to pay labor for the brickmakers. At the moment his main goal is to start the construction work, because he's currently living in a house that's poorly built. On a professional level, Luis is fulfilled and enjoys his line of work. On a personal level, he intends very soon to open a business for his wife who works as a maid.

loans.use: to purchase 30 sacks of cement, 15 truckloads of rocks, 14 iron rods and 25 stirrups, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her General Store. Through her earnings she was able to meet her daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 15,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, frozen foods which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Rosario dreams of having a bigger General Store. She prays for good health and for God to prosper her business. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a 31-year-old married woman with two children, who are both in school. 

Analyn is a very hard working entrepreneur. For two years, she has operated a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines. Analyn has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy wheels and spare parts for her tricycle.

In the future, Analyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wheels and spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 52 years old and married. 

Myrna runs a general store in the Philippines and works very hard. She has been in this business for three years, and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, cigarette, personal product care and other groceries.

In the future, Myrna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, cigarette, personal product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling fish in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 25 years, and earns more income from buying and selling dried fish. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell in her business.

Melinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 62 years old and is married with five children. With one child still in school, Marcelina works very hard to provide for her family.

Marcelina runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, cooking oil, vinegar, coffee, noodles, sugar, cereals, etc. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, such as canned goods, cooking oil, vinegar, coffee, noodles, sugar, cereals, etc. 

Marcelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, such as canned goods, cooking oil, vinegar, coffee, noodles, sugar, cereals, etc.

loans.name: Hean

texts.en:
Hean is 21-year-old single man from Kampot Province, Cambodia. He is a security guard and works for a company in the province. His father is a construction worker and his mother is a rice farmer.

Hean is pursuing a bachelor’s degree at a university in the province, majoring in finance and banking. Hean has decided to take out a loan because he is short of the money to cover his university fees from the first to the fourth year. With this loan, he will be able to cover his university fees and earn a bachelor’s degree successfully. After graduation, he dreams of having a proper job with a reasonable salary and he also wants to save money to build his own house.

loans.use: to cover his university fees from the first to the fourth year.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tools for brick making.

loans.name: Wilter

texts.es:
Wilter tiene 33 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Querocotillo que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería principalmente.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de maíz amarillo, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 15 años y tiene buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fitosanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para la cosecha de su cultivo de maíz, esto lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también a tener una cosecha oportuna y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto lo que le generará ingresos mayores que van a permitirle mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Wilter is 33 years old. He lives in a house that he owns that is made of rustic materials. Wilter lives with his wife and two children in the Querocotillo district, in the Cutervo province, Cajamarca region. Cajamarca is in Peru’s northern highlands, where the locals mainly make a living in farming, trade and cattle-raising.

Wilter makes a living in farming. He grows yellow corn and has 15 years’ experience in the work. He has good personal and professional references locally. This loan will be used in Wilter’s farming work. He will apply phytosanitary products and fertilisers to his crops. He will also pay labourers to work on his corn harvest. This loan will be good for the physiology and yield of the crops. Wilter will have a good harvest and therefore better production and a better product. As a result, he will have no problems selling the corn, which will provide him with a higher income to improve his and his family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy phytosanitary products and fertilisers and to pay labourers to use these products in farming work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to complete her Master's degree in earn, nose and throat medicine, in head and neck surgery.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Sandra works hard to support her family.

She has an internet café business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling frozen foods.  Sandra is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF in order to buy computer supplies for her internet café business.

Sandra has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy computer supplies for her internet café.

loans.name: Bayan

texts.en: Bayan is a 19-year-old single lady living in Jordan. She is studying to get her bachelor degree in E-Commerce, and she is now in her first year. The income that comes from her father’s work is the only source of income to her family of four members. But recently the market is facing some problems that lead Bayan to apply for an educational loan to help her cover her semester fees. Bayan’s future plan is to get a masters degree in the same field.

loans.use: To help her cover her semester fees

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 44 years old, and is married to Corsino and they have five children. Corsino works as a bus conductor while Rowena runs a variety store. The income they get from both their jobs enables them to manage their daily expenses and needs. 

Since raising five children is indeed a difficult thing, the couple makes sure that they are doing the best they can to support every child. Being a hardworking wife and mother, Rowena focuses herself on her business. However, sometimes she also dreams to grow this but she's basically incapable of doing so because of financial insufficiency. Thus, she wants to ask help from you. 

You can now help her make her dream come true. With a mere PHP 50,000, she can purchase additional stock and supplies of bulk grocery products to sell in her store. This will help a lot for their family most especially for their children's education. 

What you will lend could mean a lot to Rowena now. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock and supplies of grocery and school products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Msm Texas Grp Group

texts.en:
George is in his early 30s and is single with two daughters who are still in school.  He has been selling electronic money transfers and also repairs telephones for four years now.  He works from 7am to 10pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be George's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to buy spare parts for repairing telephones and sold m-pesa.  He has managed to pay back his loan successfully.  He used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayment and cover household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy more m-pesa stock.  He dreams of being an international business man.

George will share this loan with his loan group MSM TEXAS which consist of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to pay for more m-pesa electronic money transfer stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bull

loans.name: Morena

texts.en:
Morena is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Morena is 55 years old and one of her children is still in school.

Morena runs a general store in the Philippines. Morena requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Morena has been in this business for 15 years. Morena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy brake and accelerator cables, spark plugs, bulbs, cartridges, speed controllers, "Ferodo" brakes, "Globe" brake pads, motor oil etc...

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a hardworking mum aged 58, whose dream and unswerving determination to improve her living conditions and offer her family a good living condition led her to start practicing mixed farming. Grace has been farming for the past 40 years. Through these years, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practicing mixed farming.

Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, crops and some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. Grace is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day, she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plow.

Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals for resale. Kenya's Nyamira area, one of the county's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Grace could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there.

Accessing funds has been a challenge for Grace, but she now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing.

Grace believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable a permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Grace to repay this loan and secure the future of her children.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, doors, windows, electric cable, and a fuse box in order to install doors, windows and electrical power to his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is grateful that she was granted a 15000 PHP loan that she used to purchase various food supplements and products to sell. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses.

She would now like to apply for a 20000 PHP loan that she will use as to pay for more quantities of food supplements and vitamins to sell and to add some more footwear and clothing for sale. Filipinos are now more knowledgeable and health-conscious to take food supplements and vitamins for their well-being.

Margie dreams of having a worldwide distributorship for her products. She hopes to build their dream house and give her children a college education. Every week she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God that she studies.

She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her for it will surely cover their daily sustenance and for her children's education.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional products such as vitamins, food supplements, footwear and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Lauriano

texts.en:
Laureo is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a farming rice business in the Philippines.

He is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for his farming rice business.

Laureo has been in this business for 20 years. Laureo earns more income from farming vegetables as well and motorcycle transport.

He successfully repaid his previous loan and now he has requested another loan to further build his businesses.

Laureo has been sustaining his business activities through his own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. He dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for his farming rice business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
This is Victoria, 48, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses through the business she is currently operating- a Pisonet business. Aside from this, she also runs a tailoring business which helps provide adequately for the household needs.

So what’s Pisonet business? Pisonet is basically a merge of PC rental and Arcade rental services wherein customers can pay the services by inserting coins to the machine. There is more need, now than before, for services like these as customers’ demand increases. Her main patrons are students, who require her services for school requirements.

She also has people who need to rent computers for business purposes like writing a resume any office documentation; as well as people who would just love to surf the net and any social network. Since computers are much in need now, many customers jive with Victoria’s business.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 13,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional Pisonet unit for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Victoria dreams to give her family a better and sustainable livelihood. Likewise, she also wants her business to expand in progress. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional Pisonet unit for her business.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is a clever woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1982. She is living in a village with her family. She is a widow and has four children. She is an honest, communicative, and kind person. 

After the death of her husband she was left to care for her children. Recently, she is not working and needs help to start a business to feed her family. She participated in three days' training provided by IMON to startup clients and got the necessary information on how to open a business. Now she wants to do business at a domestic market retailing kids' wear and women's clothes. 

She is asking financial support from Kiva lenders to have working capital to buy a new collection of goods. 

She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy kids' and women's clothes

loans.name: Avaz

texts.en:
Avaz is 50 years old and an internally displaced person (IDP) who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and children. 

He is a farmer who has farmed seasonal fruit and vegetables for the last 17 years. During this time, Avaz has gained enough skills and experience to run the business. He chose this crop because it is profitable and fresh fruit and vegetables are in high demand. In Azerbaijan, people use fresh vegetables daily and consider them healthy. Many national dishes, such as pilau and dolma, are made of vegetables. Fresh fruits are served at every family's table and are also used to make fresh punch. 

He usually sells his goods in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 180 AZN. As his products are in high demand, he wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables. He has therefore applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN to buy new garden tools, seeds, and fertilizer. 

He has a good credit history and this will be his 4th loan.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 61 years old and married with eleven children, one of whom is in school. Mildred works very hard to provide for them.

Mildred runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mildred has been in this business for eleven years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Mildred would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Tamer

texts.en: Tamer is a 23 year old single man living in Irbid. He is studying to get her bachelor degree in software engineering, and he is now in her third year. His difficult financial situation that lead Tamer to apply for an educational loan to help him cover his semester fees. Tamer`s future plan is to work in the same field.

loans.use: cover his third year semester fees in software engineering

loans.name: Teofista

texts.en:
Teofista is 69 years old and married with six children. Teofista works very hard to provide for them.

Teofista runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries like canned goods, soft-drinks, shampoo, coffee, milk, candies, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Teofista has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items.

Teofista would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries like canned goods, soft-drinks, shampoo, coffee, milk, candies, biscuits, etc. to sell

loans.name: Nahida

texts.en:
Nahida is a 48 -year-old woman who has been engaged in milk and dairy product sales for the last 23 years. She is an IDP (internally displaced person). Nahida is widow and has four children. Milk and yogurt are very popular products among Azerbaijani people and they use it in everyday life. Her son helps her to run the business. Monthly income from her business is 180 AZN. 

Now she has 5 milking cows and she would like to purchase two more. For this reason, she has applied for a loan of  1500 AZN to purchase two more cow. She hopes very much for a positive outcome and thanks Aqroinvest in advance for their support.

loans.use: to purchase two more cows to expand her herd and provide better income

loans.name: Fhevie

texts.en:
This is Fhevie, 34, resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Willie, a driver, and mother to her two children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Fhevie operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively separated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries like factories and others. Aside from this she also runs a sari-sari store in their area. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 50, 000 loan. She will be incorporating the loan on her current revolving fund used to buy trash from collectors. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Fhevie hopes to grow her business and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also prays to have their own house. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is engage in the selling of cosmetics products and fragrances around their village. She is married to a welder and they blessed with three children. All her children are sending school. Gina admit that her income from her selling business is not enough to sustain all her children needs in school. Sometimes she works in the market as sales lady for extra income. 

Gina wants to extend the products she is selling because she believes that having more items, she can also gain bigger income. Thus, she is requesting a loan of P10,000 to buy lotion, lipstick, underwear, and many more. Gina hope that by having the loan she will increase her income and further provide her children needs.

loans.use: to buy lotion, lipstick, underwear, and much more to increase income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and herbicides for his farm so as to get a better harvest and meet client and family needs.
